title: Innovation Manager / Senior Business Analyst
description:
Founded in 2016, SurePay is the market leader in Verification of Payee (VoP) solutions. Our flagship product, IBAN-Name Check, launched in the Netherlands in 2017, has been widely adopted by major banks, insurers, lenders, telecom companies, energy providers, ministries, and government agencies.



Our VoP service prevents fraud and misdirected payments, providing confidence in online transactions. We expanded to the UK in 2019, where we lead the market in Confirmation of Payee (CoP) solutions.



With over 100 international banks trusting us with their data and over 7.5 billion VoP/CoP checks performed, SurePay continues to grow and innovate. Our future looks bright with the Instant Payment Regulation in the EU and recent wins like the Belgium RFP, positioning us as the central VoP processor for all Belgian banks.


**Your Job at SurePay**
-----------------------



SurePay is dedicated to innovation and excellence in payment solutions. We are looking for a dynamic Senior Business Analyst to join our team and lead the analysis of new markets and recent developments in the field of payments. This role will translate strategic goals into actionable development opportunities for SurePay services.



As a Senior Business Analyst at SurePay, you will work in an Agile environment, closely collaborating with customers, data suppliers, and partners to innovate and improve our product offerings. You will ensure that developments align with SurePay's strategic goals, whether it involves enhancing existing products like Confirmation of Payee and PayID or introducing new products in existing markets.



You will be detail-oriented and skilled at articulating business requirements, working closely with team members such as the solution architect and product owner to ensure that work items are ready for the scrum teams. You know how to deal with uncertainty, ready to dive into challenges and do not shy away from details and the technical side of things, e.g. by integrating third party API's yourself to quickly test a hypothesis.


**Key Responsibilities**
------------------------


* **Market Analysis**: Analyze new markets and recent developments in payments to identify opportunities for product development and expansion.
* **Business Requirements**: Draw up detailed business requirements in Jira and/or Confluence and uncover business cases for new products or improvements to existing products.
* **Customer Engagement**: Engage with customers to gain insights into their challenges and translate these into potential solutions and product enhancements.
* **Innovation**: Connect external developments, such as legislation, new techniques, and customer demands, to SurePay's future solutions.
* **Collaboration**: Work closely with technical disciplines like solution architects, product owners and development teams to translate business requirements into technical solutions.
* **Knowledge Sharing**: Present findings to the team and share knowledge to ensure a collective understanding of market and product opportunities.
* **Product Vision**: Identify market developments as input for the development or refinement of SurePay's product vision.

**Qualifications**
------------------


* **Educational Background**: Bachelor's degree in a relevant discipline. A Masters degree is an advantage.
* **Experience**: At least 5 years of experience as an Innovation Manager or Business Analyst.
* **Analytical Skills**: Excellent logical thinking and strong analytical skills to spot promising ideas.
* **Communication**: Clear communication skills, both in conversations and written English, with the ability to ask probing questions to fully understand customer needs. Good presentation skills.
* **Personal Attributes**: Proactive, resourceful, investigative, and positively critical.
* **Industry Knowledge**: Familiarity with payments, data, IT/technology, and APIs are advantages.
* **International Experience**: Experience in the international/EU banking sector is an advantage.
* **Technical Background**: A technical background or study is an advantage.
* **Lean Startup**: Experience with Lean Startup principles is an advantage.
* **Innovation**: Experience in innovation processes is an advantage.

**Why Join SurePay**
--------------------


* **Innovation-Driven Environment:** Be part of a company that thrives on solving real-world problems through innovative solutions.
* **Growth Opportunities:** Play a pivotal role in shaping SurePay's strategy and product offerings.
* **Collaborative Culture:** Work with a passionate and dedicated team committed to excellence and customer satisfaction.


You can expect a fulfilling position where you're given freedom, flexibility and autonomy on how you do your job. We have a flat structure where everyone is accessible and approachable. We work hybrid, asking our employees to come to our office in Utrecht at least once a week. There's a good social atmosphere within SurePay, with regular Friday drinks, outings and a fun quarterly meeting. And last but not least, you'll have an awesome team around you who are there to support you and collaborate.



Aside from this we also give:


* 25 holiday days annually (fulltime)
* 8% personal benefit budget
* NS business card
* Unlimited drinks and fresh fruit at the office
* A great company culture
* A pension plan to take care of you later
* And of course a competitive salary, 8% holiday allowance and Apple hardware needed for your job (Macbook Pro, iPhone etc).

**About SurePay**
-----------------


* Founded in 2016
* ± 65 employees
* 20+ nationalities
* 1 office
* Flat organisation
* (Business) Casual
* Average age: 36


SurePay makes payments easier, more personal and even more secure. We are a fast-growing FinTech SaaS company and have secured our Series A funding in September 2021. SurePay stems from an innovation program of Rabobank, started in July 2016 and has been an independent BV since the beginning of 2020. SurePay is being backed by three leading investors, Rabo Frontier Ventures, Connected Capital and Iris Capital.
  

  

As we continue to evolve and grow, we're working hard to scale further in Europe while continuing to build our talented and driven team. Currently, we're working according to agile methodologies with 5 scrum teams and a business team made up of various disciplines.



You might know us from our leading product, the IBAN-Name Check, also known internationally as Confirmation of Payee. It's used by millions of people on a daily basis and is incorporated into payment platforms of banks, corporates and governmental bodies throughout the Netherlands and the UK. We recently also connected to France, meaning we have started providing cross-border checks. We are planning to continue expanding within Europe, bringing our mission of preventing fraud and misdirected payments. Not only are we entering new markets, but also growing our services and product offering through continuous innovation.  

  

SurePay's core values are; *We Care*, *Build Together*, *Think Forward* and *Be Responsible*. These core values are the driver's of our culture and can be seen as guidelines on our beliefs and behaviour. It defines what we find important as a company and the way we work together everyday.

  

* **We Care:** We are a supportive employer and understand that health, family and safety is what really matters. We care about our employees, customers, partners and end-users. Therefore we value creating a safe workspace where everybody can be their authentic self and where we, together, work on the same mission to provide safer payments.
* **Build Together**: We believe in teamwork and strive towards the best results together with employees and customers. Our diversity, both personal and professional, is one of our key strengths.
* **Think Forward**: We are frontrunners and are on top of our game. Our customers can rely on innovative solutions to service their current and future needs. With a problem solving mindset, we anticipate challenges and adapt to a fast changing environment.
* **Be Responsible**: We all contribute to reaching our mission of reducing fraud and misdirected payments, leading to a positive impact on society. We take responsibility, show ownership and make honest decisions.

### **More information**



More information?  

careers@surepay.nl
company_description: We are a fast-growing FinTech SaaS company from the Netherlands, currently in the scale up phase. SurePay's core values are: We Care, Build Together, Think Forward and Be Responsible.

title: Technical Business Analyst Analytics Platform
description:
Do you want to contribute to the analytics platform for hundreds of users? Can you analyze complex IT process and distil them down to simple overviews? Can you on the other hand create new processes that represent reality without shortcuts?  



Ultimately, do you want to be the elite specialist who can delve into each topic, find the right people, learn from the data scientists, conduct analysis today, write documentation tomorrow, and organize knowledge sharing sessions overmorrow? Even if you are not yet 100% convinced, just read on!


The Model Serving Platform (MSP) at Rabobank is at the core of getting machine learning models into production, that is, into the bank’s information streams - from financial reporting over risk figures to combatting financial fraud.


Our teams of the Analytics Platform serve the MSP and the model’s lifecycle and we belong to the Tech 4 Data & Analytics domain which in turn belongs to the Chief Innovation and Technology Office (CITO).  



**Your Team:**


The MSP is developed and run by 3 teams with more than 20 developers and business analysts, so you will start with a solid foundation of technology and experienced people. You will work in the team that focuses on expanding directly the MSP. Besides your team, you will also be supported by a Tech Lead, a Product Owner, and an Architect.

**To Be Successful in This Role:**

**Experience:**

* A minimum of 3 years total of professional experience within the data & analytics domain is required, maybe even some exposure to AI
* Various ecosystems and processes, such as Azure Cloud and DevOps, Databricks, AzureML, deployment pipelines and governance thereof
* Practice in scrum methods and DevOps in general

Security concepts such as RBAC, ACL  
* 

**Skills:**

* Strong and proactive communication skills
* Ability to abstract existing workflows, but to also the other way around: understand concepts and guidelines to design detailed processes within existing systems
* Critical thinking about the status quo and propose specific changes to it
* Understanding of how developers in your team, but also the data scientists who are our clients
* Rudimentary knowledge of machine learning, including generative artificial intelligence, data models, and cloud infrastructure

General affinity for and curiosity about technology  
* 

**Your Responsibilities:**

* Analyze requirements by our clients, understand their goals and needs, then ultimately translate that into (technical) requirements for your developers
* Challenge and advize the business users on their ideas and needs if this is truly what they want and whether this is even technically possible in a diplomatic fashion
* Support your developer squad to create backlog items which are fully ready for implementation
* Resolve discrepancies between stakeholders’ requirements and our own technology’s capabilities by communicating and coordinating
* Represent the PO during their absence
* Communicate with other teams and stakeholders in- and outside your tribe
* Optimize or even redesign processes and workflows
* Ensure security compliance of our infrastructure with your squad and beyond mere security aspects also proper governance of the infrastructure

**What do we offer:**  

We would love to help you achieve this by focusing firmly on your growth, development, and investing in an environment where you keep learning every day. We give you the space to innovate and initiate. In this way, we offer you numerous opportunities to grow and help you exceed your expectations, to do the right thing exceptionally well, and to therefore grow as a professional. In addition, with us (on the basis of a 36-or 40 hours working week), you can also expect:

* Based on your experience: up to € 110.000,00 based on 40 hours, incl all benefits and depending on technical knowlegde and experience
* Thirteenth month's salary
* 8% holiday allowance
* an extra budget of 11% of your gross salary to be used at your discretion. Buy extra holiday hours, add more to your pension savings or ask for part of the extra budget to be paid out.
* a budget of € 750- to set up your home working space and a monthly home working allowance of up to € 40
* a personal development budget of € 1,400-
* a combination of working from home and at the office
* 100% reimbursement of commuting costs if you travel by public transport
* A pension scheme to which you contribute 3.5%
* 151.2 hours holiday per year + 1 Diversity Day per year

Relocation belongs to the possibilities  
* 

**Growing a better world together**  

You are already aware that Rabobank is a financial services provider for millions of customers in 40 countries. But did you know that we aim to contribute to real change with our “Growing a better world together” mission? We do so in countless ways, such as:

* A third of all the food we purchase is thrown away. Together with Nature & Environment, we’re working to increase awareness among consumers of how to reduce food waste.
* As part of a project with Humanitas, we are helping people who are experiencing financial difficulties to get their household finances in order.
* Together with Vluchtelingenwerk Nederland (the Dutch Council for Refugees), we are helping 1,500 refugees find a suitable job.


#LI-LH1

title: Senior Developer Azure & Databricks Analytics Platform
description:
Do you want to contribute to the analytics platform for hundreds of users? Do you have an engineering and tinkering mindset? And beyond the technical aspects, do you like to guide and advance your team members? Then continue reading!  



The Model Serving Platform (MSP) at Rabobank is at the core of getting machine learning models into production, that is, into the bank’s information streams - from financial reporting over risk figures to combatting financial fraud.


The newest ambition with the MSP will extend the existing capabilities to also cover high-performance and low-latency use cases to fight financial and economic crime.


Our teams of the Analytics Platform serve the MSP and the model’s lifecycle and we belong to the Tech 4 Data & Analytics domain which in turn belongs to the Chief Innovation and Technology Office (CITO).  



**Your Team:**


The MSP is developed and run by 3 teams with more than 20 developers and business analysts, so you will start with a solid foundation of technology and experienced people. You will work in the team that focuses on building a high-performance platform. Each team is supported by Tech Leads, Product Owners, and Architects.  



**To Be Successful in This Role:**

**Experience:** A minimum of 3-5 years of total professional experience, with at least 2 years in Azure cloud infrastructure and Databricks, as well as the ability to steer people on a technical level into the right direction. For the rest, you can rely on the Tech Lead, Product Owner, and Architect.

**Technical Skills:** Expertise in building and maintaining a high-performance ML platform primarily on Azure along with knowledge of Azure Machine Learning, Terraform, Databricks, and basics of network set-up (VLANs, etc.). Proficiency in Python, Spark, or SQL are a plus, but not required.

**Machine Learning Knowledge:** Understanding how to integrate existing models into a platform is highly desired to generate a smooth user experience.

**Network Security:** It's beneficial to have experience in network security and broader architectural knowledge to address security concerns and contribute to Azure-based solutions.

**Team player:** We expect you to integrate quickly and well with the existing team, foster a culture of collaboration without boundaries, and assuming a technically leading position in the team. This occasionally includes steering technical discussions and teaching your colleagues about best practices.

**Inquisitive Mindset:** A willingness to ask questions, explore new ideas, learn new skills, and maintain an open and collaborative approach to problem-solving. Furthermore, you should be able to take the initiative, anticipate challenges, and actively seek opportunities to drive improvements.

**Customer Focus:** A dedication to understanding and meeting the needs of our internal stakeholders and the broader organization.  



**Your Responsibilities:**

* Development, management, and maintenance of Azure infrastructure specifically tailored for high-performance machine learning and artificial intelligence applications within the Rabobank
* Utilize Terraform to build and manage infrastructure as code, ensuring scalability and reliability for machine learning projects
* Collaborate with data scientists and machine learning practitioners to provide infrastructure support for model development and deployment using Azure ML and Databricks
* Very good understanding of state-of-the-art DevOps processes, especially in the area of data science
* Apply your knowledge of network security to ensure the secure operation of our machine learning infrastructure
* Contribute to broader architectural discussions, leveraging your architectural knowledge to optimize solutions

Guide your team when creating new solutions  
* 

**What do we offer:**  

We would love to help you achieve this by focusing firmly on your growth, development, and investing in an environment where you keep learning every day. We give you the space to innovate and initiate. In this way, we offer you numerous opportunities to grow and help you exceed your expectations, to do the right thing exceptionally well, and to therefore grow as a professional. In addition, with us (on the basis of a 36-or 40 hours working week), you can also expect:

* Based on your experience: up to € 110,000- incl all benefits, based on 40 hours, depending on experience and technical knowlegde
* Thirteenth month's salary
* 8% holiday allowance
* an extra budget of 11% of your gross salary to be used at your discretion. Buy extra holiday hours, add more to your pension savings or ask for part of the extra budget to be paid out.
* a budget of € 750- to set up your home working space and a monthly home working allowance of up to € 40
* a personal development budget of € 1,400-
* a combination of working from home and at the office
* 100% reimbursement of commuting costs if you travel by public transport
* A pension scheme to which you contribute 3.5%
* 151.2 hours holiday per year + 1 Diversity Day per year
* Relocation belongs to the possibilities

**Growing a better world together**  

You are already aware that Rabobank is a financial services provider for millions of customers in 40 countries. But did you know that we aim to contribute to real change with our “Growing a better world together” mission? We do so in countless ways, such as:

* A third of all the food we purchase is thrown away. Together with Nature & Environment, we’re working to increase awareness among consumers of how to reduce food waste.
* As part of a project with Humanitas, we are helping people who are experiencing financial difficulties to get their household finances in order.
* Together with Vluchtelingenwerk Nederland (the Dutch Council for Refugees), we are helping 1,500 refugees find a suitable job.

title: Growth Marketing Analyst
description:
At Picnic, we're revolutionizing the way people buy groceries with our innovative and sustainable app-only service. We do almost everything in-house, developing cutting-edge technologies and processes to ensure we continue to grow rapidly without missing a beat. If you're a passionate Growth Marketing Analyst, we're offering you the opportunity to join the diverse team at our Amsterdam HQ and make a real difference in our scaleup environment.



 **In a nutshell**
------------------



Picnic is looking for a highly driven Growth Marketing Analyst to measure our online campaigns and take performance marketing to the next level. You will collaborate with growth and performance marketing teams working on campaigns across all digital channels. You will have a front row seat as we grow across the region and build the future of online groceries.



 **What you'll do**
-------------------


**Data Analysis and Insights:**


* Analyze data to measure our performance marketing campaigns, identify opportunities, and support our growth/marketing teams.
* Perform campaign reporting and conversion analysis, design and interpret experiment results, and deliver actionable recommendations.
* Use tools like SQL, Python, R, Tableau, and Google Analytics to generate insights from large datasets.
* Conduct customer segmentation to improve targeting.


**Measurement and Attribution:**


* Develop, implement, and test digital marketing strategies across channels to grow our customer base.
* Advise growth and performance marketing teams on proper measurement and ad attribution
* Use the latest tools and methodologies to constantly improve our measurement and analytics capabilities


**Collaboration and Communication:**


* Work with marketing, operations, and data teams on projects focusing on user growth, mobile usage, and revenue.
* Communicate campaign performance and provide actionable insights to marketing teams.
* Brainstorm and collaborate on new ideas for tests or improvements.


**Reporting and Dashboarding:**


* Create dashboards, data visualizations, and campaign performance reports.


* **About you**



* 2+ years of experience in marketing or growth analytics
* BS/MS in Computer Science, Math, Stats, or equivalent experience
* Proficiency with SQL, Python/R with the demonstrated ability to learn new scripting languages
* Experience using mobile app analytics tools such as Firebase, Mixpanel, and Apple Analytics is a huge plus
* Ability to process and analyze complex data sets, and interpret them to make business decisions
* Strong communication skills, attention to detail, and ability to manage a project or product


 **Picnic Perks**
----------------


**Every expert was once a beginner!**


* You'll get plenty of opportunities to challenge yourself and grow, Lunch & Learn sessions, and tailored soft skills training. We also offer free professional weekly language courses.


**Make a difference**


* You'll work in an awesome scale-up environment with the freedom to drive your own projects and create a visible impact.
* Our fully electric vehicles and sustainable business model mean you'll also be contributing to making the world a better place!


**Teamwork makes the dream work**


* With more than 80 nationalities across 3 countries, you'll be part of a diverse company with plenty of cool stuff to get involved with, from board game evenings to after-work drinks to our company ski trip and more!


**You are what you eat**


* You'll get freshly prepared, healthy lunches and snacks (with plenty of vegetarian, vegan, and halal options). Coffee snob? Don't worry, our amazing Picnic barista has you covered.


**Stay healthy**


* Mental health is important. As well as having the option to speak with Picnic colleagues who act as confidential advisors, our collaboration with OpenUp gives you easy access to professional psychologists, along with workshops and materials.
* There are plenty of sports communities and events to get involved with, from tennis to yoga to climbing!


**Attractive package**


* We offer competitive compensation and a pension plan that looks out for your future self as well as 25 vacation days per year, so you can recharge your batteries


**Commitment to equal opportunities**


*Picnic is an equal opportunity employer—this means that all decisions regarding applications will be based on qualifications and merit. Applicants will be regarded independently of age, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, ethnicity, skin color, civil status, religious beliefs, physical or mental disability, or any other factors protected by law.*


*At Picnic, we celebrate and value our differences and are committed to building a safe and inclusive working environment where everyone can be themselves.*

title: Research Analyst (Labour Market Specialist)
Lead IT Business Analyst
description:
**Company Description** **CREATIVITY IS OUR SUPERPOWER.** It's our heritage and it's also our future. Because we don't just make toys. We create innovative products and experiences that inspire, entertain and develop children through play. Mattel is at its best when every member of our team feels respected, included, and heard—when everyone can show up as themselves and do their best work every day. We value and share an infinite range of ideas and voices that evolve and broaden our perspectives with a reach that extends into all our brands, partners, and suppliers.

 **The Team**


Mattel's regional IT BA team of 4, operates within the Global Technology Organization (GTO). The GTOs primary purpose is to modernize our technology architecture, deliver a best-in-class, end-to-end business transformation across all brands and regions through technology, standardize global business processes through modern technology platform, improve the way we work, reduce costs across the enterprise & position Mattel for technology-enabled growth.

 **Job Description** **The Opportunity**


We are seeking a Lead IT Business Analyst to join our regional IT team in EMEA with a focus on business partnership and building subject matter expertise in the area of Supply Chain and Logistics systems. Reporting into the Sr IT Manager, primary responsibilities include liaising between IT, business users, 3PL contacts and 3rd party IT delivery partners, building expertise with Mattel’s iSeries based operational systems, analyzing business needs and helping to maintain and improve the quality of our services. The role carries opportunities to work on regional and global IT transformational projects, supporting rollouts & participating in solution discovery activities.

 **What Your Impact Will Be:**

* Regional and global IT subject matter expert in Mattel’s iSeries based operations systems with a Logistics and Supply Chain focus.
* Regional IT subject matter expert in EMEA Supply Chain & Logistics processes.
* Provide consultation and escalation point to regional business partners.
* Provide consultation for internal and external audit inquiries.
* Manage response to time sensitive, business critical support incidents.
* Work with business partners to identify and drive transformation opportunities.
* Drive adoption of tools and processes; help drive standardization of processes.
* Provide data analysis and structured insights to influence positive outcomes.
* Partner with and provide direction to outsourced IT partners.
* Lead regional and global project work with business partners and 3PL providers.

  

**Qualifications** **What We're Looking For:**

* Degree in Computer Sciences, Computer Engineering or other IT related subjects.
* Experienced iSeries operator or developer; Supply Chain or Finance applications preferred.
* 5+ years business partnering within Supply Chain and Logistics process areas.
* Problem solving skills, an analytical mindset and comfortable with high complexity.
* Experience coordinating or leading IT projects.
* Excellent interpersonal, verbal & written communication skills.
* Self-starter with the ability to work individually and part of a team.

  

**Additional Information** **What It's Like to Work Here**


We are a purpose driven company aiming to empower the next generation to explore the wonder of childhood and reach their full potential. We live up to our purpose employing the following behaviors:

* **We collaborate:** Being a part of Mattel means being part of one team with shared values and common goals. Every person counts and working closely together always brings better results. Partnership is our process and our collective capabilities is our superpower.
* **We innovate:** At Mattel we always aim to find new and better ways to create innovative products and experiences. No matter where you work in the organization, you can always make a difference and have real impact. We welcome new ideas and value new initiatives that challenge conventional thinking.
* **We execute:** We are a performance driven company. We strive for excellence and are focused on pursuing best in class outcomes. We believe in accountability and ownership and know that our people are at their best when they are empowered to create and deliver results.

 **Who We Are**


Mattel is a leading global toy company and owner of one of the strongest of children's and family entertainment franchises in the world. We create innovative products and experiences that inspire, entertain and develop children through play. We engage consumers through our portfolio of iconic brands, including Barbie, Hot Wheels, Fisher-Price, American Girl, Thomas & Friends, UNO and MEGA, as well as other popular intellectual properties that we own or license in partnership with global entertainment companies. Our offerings include film and television content, gaming, music and live events. We operate in 35 locations and our products are available in more than 150 countries in collaboration with the world's leading retail and ecommerce companies. Since its founding in 1945, Mattel is proud to be a trusted partner in empowering children to explore the wonder of childhood and reach their full potential.


Visit us at https://jobs.mattel.com/ and www.instagram.com/MattelCareers


Mattel is an Equal Opportunity Employer where we want you to bring your authentic self to work every day. We welcome all job seekers including minorities, females, individuals with disabilities, and those of all sexual orientations and gender identities.
