title: Business analist
description:
Wil jij als business analist bijdragen aan het succes van toonaangevende organisaties en je analytische vaardigheden inzetten voor maatschappelijke impact? Dan is dit je kans!

  

**Wat ga je doen?**



Als business analist bij Berenschot ben je verantwoordelijk voor het verzamelen, analyseren en presenteren van data en informatie die relevant zijn voor het managen van onze adviesprojecten en interne processen.


Je maakt gebruik van verschillende bronnen, methoden en tools om inzicht te krijgen in de vraagstukken, processen en prestaties van onze organisatie. Je maakt onder meer rapportages in PowerBi en andere visualisatietools om de resultaten van je analyses helder en overtuigend te communiceren. Je draagt bij aan de ontwikkeling en verbetering van onze data-analyse capaciteiten en je deelt je kennis en ervaring met je collega’s onder meer door het geven van trainingen.


**Met wie werk je samen?**



Berenschot is een onafhankelijk adviesbureau met meer dan 80 jaar ervaring op het gebied van strategie, organisatie, innovatie, digitalisering en data-analyse. Wij werken voor een breed scala aan opdrachtgevers in de publieke en private sector, zowel nationaal als internationaal. Onze missie is om organisaties en mensen te helpen om hun maatschappelijke en economische meerwaarde te vergroten.



Je hebt contacten in de gehele organisatie, zowel met MT-leden, team- en projectleiders als met de interne stafafdelingen.  



  

**Wat neem je mee?**


* Een afgeronde HBO- of WO-opleiding in een relevante richting, zoals bedrijfskunde, bedrijfseconomie, accountancy, informatiekunde, data management of vergelijkbaar.
* Minimaal 2 jaar werkervaring als business analist, informatie- of data analist, BI-consultant of vergelijkbaar.
* Uitstekende beheersing van PowerBi en/of andere data-analyse en visualisatietools, zoals Excel, Tableau of Qlikview. Ervaring met Afas is een pré.
* Goede communicatieve en sociale vaardigheden, zowel mondeling als schriftelijk.
* Een analytische, kritische en resultaatgerichte houding.
* Een proactieve, leergierige en flexibele instelling.
* Affiniteit met de adviesbranche en/of projectorganisatie.


**Wat bieden wij?**


* Een marktconform salaris dat past bij jouw kennis en ervaring;
* 27 vakantiedagen, met de mogelijkheid om 20 vakantiedagen bij te kopen bij een fulltime dienstverband;
* Een vrij in te delen feestdagenbudget;
* Een laptop en telefoon;
* Een thuiswerk- en reiskostenvergoeding;
* In eerste instantie een jaarcontract; blijk je een echte Berenschotter te zijn, dan krijg je een contract voor onbepaalde tijd;
* De vrijheid om in afstemming met je collega’s te bepalen waar je werkt: thuis, of op ons kantoor (bij uitstek een ontmoetingsplaats);
* Een platte organisatie met korte lijnen.


**Is dit de baan voor jou?**



Ben jij enthousiast geworden, toe aan een volgende stap in jouw loopbaan en heb je zin om het financiële hart van Berenschot samen met ons verder uit te bouwen? Solliciteer dan via de knop hieronder. Heb je nog vragen? Neem dan gerust contact op met onze recruiter Vicky Schats (v.schats@berenschot.nl / 06-25722612) en/of onze finance manager Sander van Vliet (s.vanvliet@berenschot.nl).

  


**Je hebt gesolliciteerd. En nu?**



Onze recruiter laat je zo snel mogelijk weten of je wordt uitgenodigd voor een kennismaking. Zo ja, dan volgen er twee gesprekken met collega's uit het team en je toekomstige manager. Gaat dat goed, dan vragen we je nog een assessment te doen. Blijkt ook daaruit dat je een echte Berenschotter bent, dan gaan we zo snel mogelijk over tot een mooi aanbod!

  

Gelijke kansen voor iedereen. Dat vinden wij belangrijk. Daarom hebben wij een divers en inclusief personeelsbeleid. Daarmee willen we het beste in elkaar naar boven halen. Juist omdat we allemaal anders zijn. Welke kwaliteiten kun jij toevoegen aan onze organisatie?
company_description: Wij gaan voorop in veranderingen en creëren met onze klanten iedere dag maatschappelijke en economische waarde. Wij zijn grondlegger van vooruitgang.

title: Business Analyst Intern
description:
**Job Summary:**

  



Are you ready to dive into the world of business analytics and gain hands-on experience that could launch your career? We are seeking ambitious and detail-oriented Business Analyst Interns to join our dynamic team. This internship offers an excellent opportunity to immerse yourself in our business model and data setup, providing invaluable experience and learning opportunities, with the potential for a permanent position upon successful completion.

  


**Key Responsibilities:**

  


* Data Mastery: Assist business analysts in collecting and extracting data from various sources, becoming proficient in handling real business data.
* Quality Assurance: Perform data cleaning and preparation tasks, ensuring high data quality and integrity.
* Analytical Insights: Conduct preliminary data analysis, generating insightful reports that drive decision-making.
* Visual Storytelling: Collaborate with business analysts to create compelling data visualizations and presentations.
* Repository Management: Support the team in maintaining and updating data repositories, honing your organizational skills.
* Team Collaboration: Participate in team meetings, contributing to project discussions and gaining exposure to collaborative project work.
* Dynamic Tasks: Engage in various duties as assigned by the business analyst team lead, ensuring a well-rounded experience.

  


**Qualifications:**

  


* Just finished or currently pursuing a degree in Business, Economics, Statistics, Data Science, Computer Science, or a related field.
* Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Excel; experience with data analysis tools (e.g., SQL, Python) is a plus.
* Basic understanding of data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI) is desirable.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* Eagerness to learn, a proactive attitude, and a passion for data.

  


**What We Offer:**

  


* Hands-on Experience: Work with real business data and projects, gaining practical experience that will set you apart in your career.
* Mentorship: Receive guidance and mentorship from seasoned business analysts, helping you grow and develop your skills.
* Exposure: Gain a deep understanding of our business model and data infrastructure, learning how data drives business decisions.
* Skill Development: Enhance your skills in data analysis, visualization, and project collaboration.
* Career Opportunities: Potential for a full-time position based on your performance and the company’s needs.
* Collaborative Environment: Thrive in a supportive and inclusive work environment where your contributions are valued.
* Competitive Compensation: 1000 euro compensation (plus travel reimbursement) based on a full-time, 40 hour, work week.

  



Jumpstart your career with us and embark on a journey of learning, growth, and endless possibilities. Apply today!

  

\*\**Looking for someone to join our team from start of September for a 5-6 month period for 32 - 40 hours per week. Must be located in the Netherlands\*\**

title: Data Science Lead
description:
Coolgradient is a fast-growing green-tech start-up with a clear vision to make our digital footprint more sustainable.

**Why?**

Every swipe, every like, every TikTok video we upload, every Zoom call we have, every Netflix video we watch, or everything we buy online is all processed and depends on… data centers. However, these data centers consume large amounts of energy due to the underlying technology we use every day all day.

**How?**

We have developed an AI-based analytics platform that captures the entire data center (DC) infrastructure—"from roof to room"—to bring the whole DC into a more optimal state. This platform saves energy, water, and scope 3 emissions while increasing reliability and sustainability in data centers across countries like Germany, France, the UK, Australia, and The Netherlands.

We seek a highly qualified **Data Science Lead** with extensive experience in setting up and scaling machine learning infrastructure, processes and teams.

**What you’ll do**

Being our Data Science Lead, you will be extremely important in integrating our ‘AI First’ principle within our global platform in 4 ways: people, processes, systems and models.

You will drive the design, development, deployment, and maintenance of scalable data science processes and systems. You’ll hire and manage a diverse (and potentially global) team of data scientists who support our mechanical data analysts in translating the complex context of a data center into effective and efficient (ML) models while speeding up the development and deployment process into a lean machine. Your outstanding and in-depth knowledge of (the latest) ML/ AI architectures and techniques allows you to make trade-offs in applying effective models to our data center optimization platform.

**Additionally you will**

* Be able to perform hands-on model development and deployment activities.
* Work closely with the AI research team to quickly identify new and potentially impactful developments in ML and AI.
* Support and enthuse our product managers in their quest to develop and deliver a market-changing solution that has its foundation rooted in a relentless focus on cutting-edge AI.
* Closely collaborate with our software engineers, MLOps engineers, and other stakeholders to ensure seamless integration of machine learning solutions into our products and services.

As such, this role represents a unique opportunity to have a broad impact on our organization and to contribute significantly to our technological evolution.

Job requirements

* Degree in Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science , Mathematics or a Physics related field with abundant ML experience.
* 5+ years of proven experience as a Data Scientist, preferably in a SaaS product domain.
* 1+ years experience in hiring and managing a team of data scientists.
* A preferred experience with ML/ AI that deals with physical processes and relations.
* Experience with cloud platforms and containerization technologies.
* Experience with one or more data science platforms like Dataiku, Databricks, DataRobot, etc.
* Strong programming skills in languages such as Python, Java, or Scala.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.
* Strong communication skills and ability to effectively convey technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
* Strong pre: experience with on-prem ML model training, inference and deployment for production-grade solutions.
* Pre: experience with advanced ML/ AI deployments within an industrial domain.

**Perks**

* Working on making the world of data centers more sustainable
* Enjoy a competitive salary, pension scheme, holiday allowance, and disability insurance.
* Our goal is to increase our impact and grow. We want you to grow with us and offer an Employee Stock Option Plan.
* A hybrid home-office-remote policy with flexible working hours where we value your regular presence to enjoy team dynamics, but we like to support the flexibility that fits your daily rhythm and preference.
* Lots of mobility options, where we provide a public transportation subscription, or company bike, or we’ll reimburse your travels when you prefer to use your own means of mobility.
* Lots of opportunities for professional growth and development.
* Join activities like meetups or (business) events.
* Work abroad with the team, where we combine good weather, a great environment, and good food.
* And above all: a fun and enthusiastic team that values a diverse and transparent culture.

**Visa**

At our company, we highly appreciate and encourage diversity. We believe it is crucial to achieving success and being the responsible company we want to be. However, *our company currently cannot sponsor any work visas.*

Apply to this link: https://coolgradient.recruitee.com/o/data-science-lead

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: €3.000,00 - €8.000,00 per month

Work Location: Hybrid remote in 1062 Amsterdam Nieuw-West

title: Consultant informatiemanagement
description:
**Wat ga jij doen als Consultant informatiemanagement?**

Als Consultant Informatiemanagement adviseer je klanten over het effectief en verantwoord inzetten van hun informatievoorziening en hoe deze te organiseren en beheersen. Jij helpt klanten hun IT zo in te richten en strategisch te sturen dat het maximaal bijdraagt aan hun organisatiedoelen. Dat betekent dat je de werking van de IT-organisatie, IT-processen en IT-aansturing bij klanten analyseert. Op basis daarvan geef je advies over de besturing die past bij de doelen en kenmerken van de organisatie, inclusief de benodigde rollen voor optimale IT-ondersteuning tijdens hun digitale transformatie.

In deze rol verbind je de business en IT, en breng je de uitdagingen van beide goed naar voren. Je kunt optreden als analist, specialist, proces- of informatiemanager. Het is een afwisselende functie, waarbij je voor meerdere opdrachtgevers verschillende rollen vervult. Door je brede inzetbaarheid werk je samen met diverse specialisten van de klant en collega's van Highberg.

**Voorbeelden van projecten die jij uitvoert als Consultant informatiemanagement**

De rode draad is dat je het leuk vindt om opdrachtgevers te helpen bij een optimale inrichting en besturing van de informatievoorziening. Voorbeelden van projecten die je uitvoert:

* Je voert een analyse uit op de volwassenheid van de regieprocessen van IT en doet voorstellen voor verbetering op zowel processen, rollen als besturing. In 3 maanden vorm je samen met een collega een zo goed mogelijk beeld van de organisatie van IT aan de hand van onze methodiek en leveren jullie een analyse, inclusief voorgestelde roadmap voor verbetering, op aan de klant.
* Je helpt een overheidsorganisatie met het optimaliseren van de organisatie om te voldoen aan het IV-stelsel Rijk. Je inventariseert de stakeholders, interviewt diverse belangrijke spelers, leest je in over de historie en doet voorstellen voor uitgangspunten en uiteindelijke invulling.
* Je stelt een informatiestrategie en informatieplannen op voor een uitvoeringsorganisatie waarin aandacht is voor de uitdaging van vandaag de dag zoals inzet van AI, compliancy aan (Europese) wetgeving en duurzaamheidsafwegingen. Je faciliteert inspiratiesessies met business en IT, werkt samen met gebruikers, informatiearchitecten en specialisten op diverse aandachtsgebieden.
* Je coacht informatiemanagers in hun rol en adviseert hen in de uitdagingen waar zij voor staan. Je kijkt mee waar zij tegen aan lopen in de praktijk en bent een sparringspartner die ook zo nu en dan de handen uit de mouwen steekt om te helpen.

**Wat is onze visie op Informatiemanagement?**

Informatievoorziening vormt het hart van veel organisaties. IT-toepassingen moeten altijd beschikbaar zijn en data moet betrouwbare management- en verantwoordingsinformatie opleveren voor strategische beslissingen. Toenemende eisen vanuit wet- en regelgeving en ethische overwegingen spelen een cruciale rol in de vormgeving van informatievoorziening.

Onze klanten staan midden in de maatschappij en gebruiken IT-toepassingen vaak voor samenwerking met partners, waardoor deze toepassingen waardevol moeten zijn voor klanten en burgers. Onze adviezen hebben daardoor vaak direct maatschappelijke impact. Organisaties moeten waarde toevoegen en verantwoord handelen. Een effectieve informatievoorziening is hierin een essentiële schakel.

Wij begrijpen deze waarde en verbinden verschillende disciplines, waarbij we informatievoorziening benaderen met de vragen: 'Wat kan, wat mag en wat is wenselijk?'. Zo dragen wij bij aan een informatievoorziening die bijdraagt aan het succes van maatschappelijke organisaties.

**Wat vragen wij?**

* Een afgeronde HBO- of WO-opleiding op het gebied van informatie-, organisatie- of bedrijfskunde;
* Minimaal 4 jaar ervaring in de IT, informatiemanagement, regie. Of brede ervaring in (IT-)consultancy;
* Kennis over en ervaring met informatiemanagement, regie-organisaties, en gerelateerde werkwijzen zoals IT-servicemanagement voor besturing en beheersing van IT;
* Uitstekende beheersing van de Nederlandse taal in woord en geschrift;
* Een commerciële instelling, analytisch sterk en een proactieve aanpak in relatiebeheer, netwerken en offertetrajecten.

**Wie ben jij?**

* Je hebt een breedbeeld van nieuwe ontwikkelingen op gebied van wetgeving, veiligheid en ethiek, inzet van data en A.I., duurzaamheid en hun betekenis voor de klant;
* Je bent communicatief vaardig en een organisatiesensitief persoon die op verschillende niveaus weet te communiceren en adviseren;
* Iemand die een probleem snel kan doorgronden en dat zo eenvoudig mogelijk kan verwoorden;
* Iemand die het leuk vindt om bij te dragen aan uitdagende, maatschappelijk relevante opdrachten en vraagstukken.

**Wat bieden wij?**

* Een marktconform salaris en uitstekende secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden waaronder prestatiebeloning, voorzieningen voor mobiliteit, pensioen en verlof;
* Oprechte aandacht voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling waaronder coaching door collega’s, toegang toe en breed opleidings- en trainingsaanbod en een persoonlijk ontwikkelplan met bijpassende investeringen;
* Een plek binnen een uitdagende en groeiende organisatie waar het nemen van eigen verantwoordelijkheid wordt gewaardeerd, je de autonomie en vrijheid hebt om je werk flexibel uit te voeren met korte communicatielijnen met collega’s;
* Een prettige werkomgeving met een prettig en goed bereikbaar kantoor, focus op prestaties als team en niet op het individu en tal van sociale activiteiten zoals borrels, sportactiviteiten en teamsamenkomsten.

**Over het team**

Bij Highberg zijn we proactief, positief en werken we graag samen. Zo helpen wij elkaar nieuwe dingen te leren en het beste uit onszelf te halen. Binnen Digital Transformation word je onderdeel van de expertisegroep Sourcing & IT Governance. Deze groep bestaat uit ongeveer 25 personen, bestaande uit zowel medewerkers als associates. Sourcing & IT Governance kan worden gezien als een goede afspiegeling van Digital Transformation. Binnen de expertisegroep zijn namelijk zeer ervaren senior consultants werkzaam, maar ook recent gestarte juniors. Daarnaast is er veel diversiteit in studieachtergronden, van bestuurskunde tot informatiemanagement, wat zorgt voor een mooie wisselwerking van kennis en ervaring. 

**We helpen je graag!**

Direct solliciteren? Kijk dan op: https://highberg.com/nl/vacatures/consultant-informatiemanagement

Als je vragen hebt of verder door wilt praten over deze vacature of over de mogelijkheden binnen Highberg, neem dan contact op met HR te bereiken via HR.DT.NL@highberg.com of 079 - 368100.

Soort dienstverband: Fulltime

Taal:

* Nederlands (Vereist)

Werklocatie: Hybride werken in 2719 EN Zoetermeer
company_addresses:
Barbara Strozzilaan 201
1083 HN Amsterdam
The Netherlands
company_description: We are Highberg. A merger of seven boutique firms. We deliver best in class services in digital organizational and sustainability transformation.

title: Business Analist
description:
*Als je van deze keywords houdt past deze rol bij je:*  

*#data #analist #SCRUM #SAFe #agile*

Heb jij als Business Analist ervaring binnen integratie teams en wil je als consultant aan de slag? Als Business Analist speel je een belangrijke rol in de vertaalslag van business naar IT bij opdrachtgevers.


Ons S-platform team bestaat uit een groep consultants met verschilende achtergronden en richt zich voornamelijk op MuleSoft en deels op Tibco, Azure en Java. In teams werken we samen met consultants van andere units aan impactvolle cloud-, integratie- en transformatie oplossingen voor klanten in de retail, telecommunicatie, media, logistiek, energie, financiële en publieke sector.


Business analisten zijn de inhoudelijke analyse experts binnen de projectorganisatie. Ze zijn een volwaardige gesprekspartner voor alle stakeholders (business en product owners, projectmanagers, architecten, developers). Informatie analyse breng je bij onze opdrachtgevers in de praktijk door het uitvoeren van requirements assessments, procesanalyse en verbetering en implementatie. Daarnaast stem je de wensen af met de omgeving van onze opdrachtgevers en zet jij je domeinkennis in om veranderingen te laten slagen en draag je actief bij aan de uitbouw en doorontwikkeling van het S-Platform team.


  
**Jouw ervaring & skills:**

* [Must-have] Je hebt ervaring als informatie analist en/of requirements analist, data analist of procesanalist binnen integratie teams.
* [Must-have] Affiniteit met IT, houdt de laatste ontwikkelingen bij en bent conceptueel in staat om analyses te vertalen naar IT oplossingen.
* [Must-have] Beschikt over Agile/SCRUM en/of SAFe ervaring en certificering en je hebt ruime ervaring in het werken in Agile teams.
* [Must-have] Je beheerst de Nederlandse taal zowel mondeling als schriftelijk.
* [Nice-to-have] Je hebt BCS en/of IREB business analyse certificaten en hebt kennis van het integratie landschap.

Als je er niet helemaal zeker van bent dat je aan bovenstaande eisen voldoet, maak je dan geen zorgen. Solliciteer gewoon. Samen ontdekken we wat jij in huis hebt, in welke rol je het beste past en hoe je bij Devoteam zou kunnen groeien. Bovendien veroordelen we elke vorm van discriminatie en beloven we gelijke kansen en behandeling voor iedereen die solliciteert. Wij nemen de beste persoon voor de rol aan, gebaseerd op vaardigheden en potentieel.


**Wat je terugkrijgt:**

* Een vast contract vanaf het begin, zodat je vol vertrouwen je toekomst kunt plannen.
* Een uitgebreid arbeidsvoorwaardenpakket, waaronder een bonusregeling, en een aantrekkelijk salaris op basis van je ervaring.
* Een uitgebreid pakket arbeidsvoorwaarden, variërend van een lease/mobiliteitsbudget, internetvergoeding en home office gear tot een pensioenfonds en collectieve zorgverzekering.
* Een gepersonaliseerd carrière ontwikkelingsplan met carrière specifieke trainingen in soft- & hard skills en certificeringen afgestemd op jouw vakgebied.
* We zullen alle mogelijkheden faciliteren om jou als thought leader te laten groeien met het delen van kennis en visie via blogs, keynote sessies en meer.
* De mogelijkheid om 4 weken in het buitenland te werken, in overleg met je team/manager.
* Interne community kennisdelingssessies waar je leert en plezier hebt, van onze tweewekelijkse Tech Thursdays tot KISSes (Knowledge & Information Sharing Sessions).
* Als je bij ons komt werken vanuit het buitenland regelen we een visum, vlucht en hotel voor de eerste paar weken voor jou en je familie. Daarnaast helpen we je met integratie in de Nederlandse cultuur en alle expat-informatie die je nodig hebt.

*#techies in ons hoofd, #creatief in ons hart, #verandering in ons DNA.*

Je maakt deel uit van een stel Tech liefhebbers in een fail-safe cultuur waar iedereen, van slimme talenten tot ervaren guru’s, wordt aangemoedigd om voortdurend te innoveren en te groeien. Wij zijn een community die trots is op wie je bent en je helpt te worden wie je wilt zijn. Met meer dan 33 nationaliteiten zijn we trots op onze multiculturele werkomgeving. Onze dieetwensen: we zijn allergisch voor onnodige hiërarchieën en overdreven processen. Bij Devoteam is verandering de enige constante factor.


Wij stimuleren verandering en brengen creatieve technologische ideeën tot leven voor onze klanten. We doen dit met 10.000 business & tech experts EMEA-breed. Onze multidisciplinaire teams spelen in de forntlinie van technologische innovatie en helpen toonaangevende bedrijven met een future-proof IT fundering. Onze bekroonde EMEA-partnerships met Microsoft, Salesforce, Google, AWS & ServiceNow stellen ons in staat om hoogstaande oplossingen te leveren en jouw carrièrepad te versterken. Naast deze EMEA partnerships werken we ook lokaal samen met belangrijke tech innovators zoals Elastic, Atlassian & Red Hat.


**Vragen over de vacature? Neem dan contact op met** **Rashana Kalloe via rashana.kalloe@devoteam.com of bel naar +316-43219021**
company_description: Devoteam is a leading consulting firm focused on digital strategy, tech platforms, cybersecurity and business transformation.

title: Change Manager Tech DBNL
description:
ING is one of the most innovative banks in the world. We are empowering people to stay a step ahead in life and in business and encourage you to ‘do your thing’. We are a global company with an agile way of working. Our technological platform is at the heart of ING's strategy, providing rapidly capabilities that enable our business to provide scalable business applications while safeguarding our security and operational resilience. With technology changing in a fast pace, we as Domestic Bank Netherlands are the enabler for Tech NL.


The change manager is one of the crucial roles in the Domestic Bank Netherlands and plays a key role in ensuring that changes are managed compliant with the global and local standards and guidelines.


In the Global Job Profile, the roles mentioned as Process Experts which cover the summary job description as: “designs and supports achieving the organization's vision by improving efficiency and effectiveness, quality and time, and customer and employee satisfaction of ING's end-to-end processes to enable the delivery of easy and uniform processes across the organization that are compliant”.


This role participates in:

* the change management board of Tech/DBNL
* the Global Change Management Guild
* the Cross Domain Control Board
* the walkthroughs with the First Line Risk team
* audits such as CAS, KPMG, or ECB


In a nutshell, this role is the go-to-person for topics related to Change Management.


If you are excited about the role, then please apply for this position.

**Roles and Responsibilities:**


Do you feel attracted by the type of roles mentioned above? Then read on!


As change manager, together with the existing 5 DBNL Change managers, you will be one of the spokespersons for the change management and the point of contact for (senior) management. This will be approximately 60% of your time as Change manager. You will align with (senior IT) management (CLs, IT(A)Ls, and CIO) and might regularly participate in the management meetings, but also go into discussions with Domain engineers related to the change management request. We do get our hands dirty, meaning we are not dictating to squads what to do, but we try to understand them and enable them by putting in the effort to solve the challenges the squads run into. When the squads experience issues they cannot solve themselves and it impacts progress on the initiatives that you drive, they might come to you for help. You do not always have to solve it yourself, but you will take it on and make it happen, you will involve the right people and make sure the issue is solved.


Next to that, for 40% of your time, you will be working for the Area Mortgages NL focusing on quality improvement and supporting the Mortgages Tribe to get to a higher level. These can be topics like improving the approach to ITSM (IT Service Management) processes, providing insights and guiding major improvements and migrations, or other quality oriented topics.

**How to Succeed**

* An all-round self-starting change professional with experience in driving and delivering complex change initiatives
* High resilience, the ability to deal with ambiguity and a focus on collaboration
* Proactive, a can-do mentality, a positive mind-set and organisational sensitivity
* Ability to coach colleagues on-the-job
* Excellent level of English & communication skills
* Analytic mindset
* You have a passion for Continuously Improving (always looking for how to improve our way of working and processes)
* High quality standards


This position covers two parts (responsibilities). Please kindly find the roles and responsibilities.

**(Operational) Change Management** for the **Products**/Investments/Consumer Loans and Insurance domains and for **Core Bank&Advisory**/Mortgages NL/Business Lending and Real Estate Finance domains

* Helping squads to manage their changes to be compliant with the global and local standards and guidelines
* Checking quality of the changes
* Educating engineers/squads regarding the Change Management process
* Reporting to MT on Change Quality and Process
* Participating in the DBNL Change Control Board (
* Participating in the DBNL Cross Domain Control Board
* Participating in (preparation of) Walkthroughs
* Participating in internal (e.g. CAS) and external (e.g. ECB) audits

**Process expert role** at Core Bank&Advisory/Mortgages NL

* Advising management on ITSM process issues and improvements
* Primary contact point to all ITSM related support
* Participating in ITSM process task forces with the aim to improve the quality and reliability of our services
* Guiding Major Improvement and Migrations within the Tribe Mortgages
* Continuous Improvement


If you have experience in a change management role and the role definition matches your ambitions, Then please apply!


You report to Mortgages NL IT Area Lead

***Further details***

* Start date August 22, 2024
* Location is Amsterdam, a.o. ING Haarlerbergpark. You will be able to do much of your work from home.
* No need to write a lengthy application letter. Though it is allowed of course and might help to get our conversation-starting, it is also OK if you apply simply by submitting your CV.
* If you have questions or just want to have a short chat or talk about this position, please contact the hiring manager at mark.nijssen-gerichhausen@ing.com

**Rewards & benefits**  

We want to make sure that it’s possible for you to strike the right balance between your career and your private life. You can find out more about our employment conditions at https://www.ing.jobs/netherlands/Why-ING/benefits.htm


The benefits of working with us at ING include:

* A salary tailored to your qualities and experience
* 24-27 vacation days depending on contract
* Pension scheme
* 13th month salary
* Individual Savings Contribution (BIS), 3.5% of your gross annual salary
* 8% Holiday payment
* Personal growth and challenging work with endless possibilities
* An informal working environment with innovative colleagues
* Work Agile, so new ideas come to life faster
**About us**  

With 60,000 employees and operations in approximately 40 countries, there is no shortage of opportunities for people with initiative who want to help people take a step ahead in life and in business. Do you want to work at the cutting edge of what’s possible and at the same time ensure you work with integrity and hold the customer’s interests at heart? Do you want to be surrounded by progressive, inspiring, diverse and supportive colleagues? Then there is no better place to invest your talents than at ING. Join us. Apply today.
company_description: With 9 million account holders, ING is one of the largest and most prominent financial service providers in the Netherlands. We are part of ING Group, a global financial institution.
ceo_name: Steven van Rijswijk, CEO ING Group

title: Full Stack Engineer
description:
Role Description:

At Booking.com, data drives our decisions. Technology is at our core. And innovation is everywhere. But our company is more than datasets, lines of code or A/B tests. We’re the thrill of the first night in a new place. The excitement of the next morning. The friends you make. The journeys you take. The sights you see. And the food you sample. Through our products, partners and people, we make it easier for everyone to experience the world.



With over 1.6 million room nights booked every day, accommodation represents the largest share of our business to date. Our mission is to deliver the best customer experience and the most varied selection of properties.



At Booking.com we combine the best traits of a start-up with the resources. We are working towards creating the ultimate travel experience, building and improving great products for both travellers and the accommodation partners.


**What you'll be doing**
------------------------


* *Solve complex technical problems to improve our development process and unlock new business opportunities.*
* *Take initiative to improve existing solutions, challenge decisions, propose augmented alternatives and address technical debt.*
* *Drive the collaboration within the team, across teams, roles and departments. We value individual work as much as your contribution to brainstorm sessions, pair programming and code reviews. Even when we work remotely we fail and succeed together.*
* *Be ambitious, open to learn and adjust to frequent changes. We treat our mistakes as opportunities to improve.*
* *Own your decisions and deliver on your promises. Be the one who cares and takes action.*
* *Rely on data in problem identification and solution evaluation. If the data is not enough, do the research and share your findings.*
* *Be pragmatic in planning and fast in execution. Prioritize based on the impact and limit the scope of the initial implementation. Validate your ideas and solutions sooner.*
* *Keep the customer at the center of everything you do. The success of your work is defined by the efficiency of the platform, its convenience for the internal users and the value we all can bring to our partners and clients.*
* *Respect Booking.com values, promote equality and contribute to our diverse environment, open for participation from individuals with different ideas, perspectives, and backgrounds.*

**What you'll bring**
---------------------


* *4+ years of working on frontend and backend tasks.*
* *1+ years of working with Node.js and TypeScript or Flow.*
* *Extensive knowledge of the JavaScript ecosystem including good understanding of Webpack, Babel, Rollup and Lerna.*
* *Hands-on experience of building or managing React or Vue.js applications.*
* *Solid understanding of Service Oriented Architecture, Microservices, FP and OOP design patterns.*
* *Experience with cloud platforms and container technologies, i.e. Amazon AWS, Docker, Kubernetes.*
* *You own your systems end-to-end and are comfortable performing incident management.*

Preferred qualifications:
-------------------------


* *You worked with large scale distributed systems, highly available APIs, and products that impact millions of customers.*
* *Experience with architecture, deployment and configuration of enterprise class applications.*
* *Experience in building Webpack plugins and/or understanding of Webpack 5 module federation.*
* *Experience in optimizing web application build processes and/or runtime performance.*
* *Experience in creating, managing and optimizing performance of Node.js services running in a cloud environment.*
* *Experience using GraphQL and Apollo in production on server and client sides.*
* *Excellent communication skills, you are able to influence and cooperate with people at all levels.*
* *Experience applying data analytics to solve technical and business problems.*
* *You are a humble and thought leader, you lead by example and gain your teammates respect through your actions and not your title.*
* *You own your systems end-to-end, ready to be on-call to take care of critical systems and manage potential incidents.*


**Benefits:**


* Contributing to a high scale, complex, world renowned product and seeing real-time impact of your work on millions of travelers worldwide
* Working in a fast-paced and performance driven culture
* Opportunity to utilize technical expertise, leadership capabilities and entrepreneurial spirit
* Promote and drive impactful and innovative engineering solutions
* Technical, behavioral and interpersonal competence advancement via on-the-job opportunities, experimental projects, hackathons, conferences and active community participation
* Competitive compensation and benefits package


The hiring company **Booking.com Customer Service Center (Shanghai) Co. Ltd.** is one of Booking.com BV’s support companies in China. Booking.com Customer Service Center (Shanghai) Co. Ltd. is looking for a *Full Stack Software Engineer*. Booking.com BV is the company behind Booking.com™, the market leading online accommodation reservation service in the world. All references to “Booking.co” refer to Booking.com BV.
company_description: Making it easier for everyone to experience the world.

title: Product Owner Transaction Monitoring (TM)
description:
As Product Owner Platform within the Area of Transaction Monitoring you can have societal impact by building the best platform to enable analytics models. These models are processing Rabobank transactions of 8+ million customers to detect Financial Crime. You will lead a multi-disciplinary squad of Data-, PowerBI-, and Test Automation-Engineers and an Analytics Translator.


**You and your job**  

Imagine yourself in in the middle of a rapidly changing environment and model landscape in the Area of Transaction Monitoring (TM) Detection, Tribe Financial Economic Crime (FEC) Tech. This Area is responsible for protecting the bank and our customers worldwide from the negative effects of financial crime. As a Product Owner, together with your squad, you have a profound impact on the TM area by being responsible for maintaining and improving the platform in our TM model ecosystem. In practice this means that you have a big responsibility in ensuring that our platform is robust and future proof by improving the data quality and data control framework. The squad is technically driven while enabling the translation of functional requirements to the platform. It consists of extremely capable, enthusiastic, and ambitious professionals and there is a positive, cooperative atmosphere. It is important you feel comfortable in a transparent and open team environment where the social aspect is important.

**PracticalExamples**

As Product Owner Platform you will:

* Fulfil the role of actively involved fore(wo)man for one or multiple squads, with mostly a focus on engineering (very limited non-technical stakeholders)
* Constantly switch between the technical details of the platform and the overarching implications on the entire model
* Provide transparent, timely and accurate feedback/updates on planning, progress and dependencies. Work with all stakeholders (which are mainly the other 10+ squads working on the model) to pre-agree the content of the Quarterly Business Review (QBR)
* Coach your squad on the day-to-day business, while having a clear view on future plans in relation to the platform (and model) vision

**Facts & Figures**

* 36 hours per week
* 8+ squad members in your squad
* 2 other squads maintaining valuable parts of our platform, to closely align with

**Top 3 responsibilities**

* Maintain and improve the platform in our TM model ecosystem (tech stack contains PySpark, DataBricks, Azure DevOps)
* Set priorities for your squad, ensure your squad commits to a realistic quarterly planning, and manage risks in a timely manner
* Together with other POs, Product Manager, Tech Leads and Area Lead, outline a vision for the platform in the rapidly expanding TM model landscape

**Together we achieve more than alone**  

We believe in the power of difference. Bringing together people's differences is what makes us an even better bank. So we are very curious about what you can bring to our team in the Tribe FEC Tech.


The ~200 people in our Transaction Monitoring team are responsible for detecting money laundering and terrorism financing risks, using analytics models. Working together is the way we work; as 1 multi-disciplinary, highly talented and motivated team at Rabobank. Talking of Rabobank: we are a Dutch bank that operates in 38 countries for over 9,5000,000 customers. Together with these customers, our members and partners we stand side by side to create a world in which everyone has access to enough healthy food. In the Netherlands we work to create a country in which people are happy with how they live, work and do business.

**You and your talent**

* Academic degree in a technical field (e.g., computer science, mathematics, econometrics or similar)
* 5+ years of experience as Product Owner/Project Manager or similar role in the field of IT
* Professional experience in leading and developing IT squads
* Confident in having detailed content discussions with team members
* Strong communication skills; concise and top-down communication is highly appreciated
* Strong ability to manage people from different disciplines and motivate, inspire and coach them
* Ability to quickly understand both technical details and business perspective
* Thrive in a high-impact, dynamic and high-paced environment
* Pro-active, independent and have a can-do mentality to make the difference in fighting financial crime
* Preferred but not required: experience in fighting Financial Economic Crime

**This is what we offer you**

* up to € 7.307 gross per month (scale 9 or 10), depending on your experience
* Extra budget of 11% of your gross salary to be used at your discretion. Buy extra holiday hours, add more to your pension savings or ask for part of the extra budget to be paid out
* Thirteenth month's salary and 8% holiday allowance

  

This is a selection of the terms of employment for a Product Owner Platform based on a [36]-hour working week. You can find all terms of employment on rabobank.jobs/en/conditions-of-employment.

**You and the job application process**


Reply to the vacancy for Product Owner Platform at Rabobank.

* Any questions about the job content? Contact: Lieke Hölscher, Area Lead TM Detection via Lieke.Holscher@rabobank.nl.
* Any questions about working at Rabobank and the process? Marloes Toma, Recruiter via Marloes.Toma@Rabobank.nl
* We will hold the interviews through a video call.
* You can find answers to the most frequently asked questions on rabobank.jobs/en/faq.
* A security check is part of the process.
* We respect your privacy.


#LI-MT1

title: Principal Engineer
description:
You have the opportunity to work in the beating heart of data within Rabobank. You collaborate with colleagues who have an insatiable interest in technology and self-development. You invest in your career. As a Lead Engineer / Principal Engineer, Senior Engineer Azure, you make a difference in technology, process, and people.


Within the Data & Analytics Tribe, you work on the data-driven enterprise. The tribe consists of 6 areas, namely:

* Global Data & Data Governance Platform
* Analytics Platform
* Data & Factory Services
* Data Science
* Business Intelligence
* Customer Analytics


Our areas together comprise approximately 50 squads. For many of the squads, Azure is the foundation on which we build. We need your help to create ground breaking solutions for our 7 million customers.


This vacancy falls within the Global Data & Data Governance Platform area. Within this area, we work with 18 squads on the "global governed data marketplace" for Rabobank. Based on your profile and competencies, we determine where you can make the most impact.

**You & Your Role**  

We are taking the next step in our transformation and therefore opening this position. We are moving our organization from IT to Tech. As a Principal Engineer, you are the visionary who supports technical projects and brings advanced data solutions to life. Your role is crucial in shaping the technical architecture, designing innovative systems, and implementing solutions that manage and analyze data optimally. And when necessary, you step in to solve high-urgency issues.


You are here to make an impact, and you do this by:

* Taking a leadership role in projects related to data and Azure, pushing the boundaries of what is possible.
* Designing and implementing scalable, cutting-edge data solutions in the Azure ecosystem. Collaborating closely with multidisciplinary teams to determine and monitor the technical direction.
* Striving for the highest standards in data management and security by evaluating and implementing best practices.
* Solving complex technical issues and acting as a mentor and guide for your team.
* Staying ahead with research into new technologies and tools, applying them to improve the data infrastructure.
* Viewing the world with a growth mindset. As mentioned earlier, we assess where your competencies are best suited.

**With Your Talents**:


It is logical that innovation, coaching, impact, communication skills, and vision are indispensable for the role of Principal Engineer. Additionally, it is important that you recognize yourself in the following checklist:

* Demonstrable academic level (Master) in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
* Your programming skills (10-15 years of experience) are sharp, with expertise in languages such as Python and SQL, but the exact language doesn't matter to you.
* You have extensive experience with Azure services such as Azure Datalake Gen2, Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks, and Azure SQL Database or perhaps Airflow.
* You are a trusted coach and thought leader within your field, especially regarding future developments in technical languages and techniques.
* Outside the organization, you have built a network.
* Within your expertise, you are known in the community and share knowledge and skills.
* Innovation is in your DNA, and you play a leading role in exploring new technologies and actively contributing to innovation within the organization.
* Your ability to provide advice is unparalleled, and you are an essential link in the Agile work process.
* Achieving consensus between teams for complex technical solutions is second nature to you.
* You excel in clear communication and create a shared understanding among stakeholders.
* Most importantly, you have an insatiable interest in technology and self-development.

**What do we offer?**  

We would love to help you achieve this by focusing firmly on your growth, development, and investing in an environment where you keep learning every day. We give you the space to innovate and initiate. In this way, we offer you numerous opportunities to grow and help you exceed your expectations, to do the right thing exceptionally well, and to therefore grow as a professional. In addition, with us (on the basis of a 36-or 40 hours working week), you can also expect:

* Based on your experience: up to a yearly salary including all benefits of € 134,000, - gross per month (scale 11)
* Thirteenth month's salary and 8% holiday allowance
* An extra budget of 11% of your gross salary to be used at your discretion. Buy extra holiday hours, add more to your pension savings or ask for part of the extra budget to be paid out.
* A budget of € 750- to set up your home working space and a monthly home working allowance of up to € 40-
* A personal development budget of € 1,400-
* A combination of working from home and at the office
* 100% reimbursement of commuting costs if you travel by public transport
* 151.2 hours holiday per year + 1 Diversity Day per year
* Relocation belongs to the possibilities


This is a selection of the terms of employment for a Principal Engineer based on a 36-hour working week. You can find all terms of employment on rabobank.jobs/en/conditions-of-employment.

**You and the job application process**


Reply to the vacancy for Principal Engineer / Lead Engineer at Rabobank.

* Any questions about working at Rabobank and the process? You can ask out IT Recruiter Raphael.Drenthel@rabobank.nl
* We will hold the interviews through a video call.
* You can find answers to the most frequently asked questions on rabobank.jobs/nl/veelgestelde-vragen.
* A security check is part of the process.
* We respect your privacy.


#LI-RD2

title: Controls Project Engineer
description:
Job Title
Controls Project Engineer
Job Description
External Job Description
Controls Project Engineer
Would you like to progress your career in a dynamic, rewarding and market-leading environment? If the answer is “yes”, then look no further than Vanderlande! We’ll give you the opportunity to work with our inspiring and talented experts on world-class projects – while growing your network, broadening your experience and expanding your horizons.
Your position  

As Controls Project Engineer you design and program PLC controls for our material handling systems at our office in Veghel, meeting high quality demands on a project basis. During the engineering phase you work closely together with a multidisciplinary project team to deliver a Functional Specification. After that, you are responsible for the detailed design, programming, and testing of the PLC software.
When the engineering phase is finished, you will go to the customer site to do the commissioning of the conveyor system. The customer site can be anywhere in the world. During this commissioning phase you carry out functional testing of the PLC hardware and software.
You are also responsible for integrating your PLC software in the overall control system and assist in the customer acceptance testing. During the execution of the project you closely monitor the available budget and the agreed schedule, and you take the appropriate actions when necessary.
Your department  

The Project Engineering department is responsible for the worldwide execution of projects in which the different components (mechanical, electromechanical and controls) of our material handling systems are implemented. Working under the supervision of a Project Leader, closely working together with the Integration Manager, Mechanical and Electrical Engineers, the Controls Project Engineer is part of a multidisciplinary team of Engineers.
Your profile  

* Successfully completed education at HBO (higher vocational education) level in Mechatronics, Electrical Engineering, Industrial Automation, Computer Science or Controls Technology
* At least 3 years’ experience in a comparable position is preferred
* Strong analytic skills
* Proactive, pragmatic and hands on attitude
* Delivering feedback and best practice to improve our products
* Communicating with regular progress reports
* Managing deadlines and milestones
* Knowledge of and experience in PLC applications (TIA Portal)
* Willing to work regularly for extended periods in other countries (up to 50% of your time)
* Good command of the English language
* Good command of the Dutch language is preferred

What we offer  

In the challenging and responsible position of Controls Project Engineer you will have the chance to make a significant contribution to the growth and profitability of Vanderlande Industries.
This position offers a competitive salary range of € 4.117 to € 4.631 gross per month (excluding 8% holiday allowance). Through exceeding performance expectations, you even have the possibility to grow outside this scale.* 40 vacation days (20 statutory days and a flexible budget worth 20 days).
* Flexible working hours.
* A hybrid workplace (40% working from home and 60% in the office).
* A Health & Wellbeing budget worth € 300,- per calendar year.
* Commuting allowance, including full reimbursement of travel by public transport.
* Working from home allowance.
* Collective pension scheme and discount on additional health insurance.
* On-site company health centres with a gym, physiotherapists, and occupational therapists.
* Vanderlande Academy and training facilities to boost your skills.
* A variety in Vanderlande Network communities and initiatives.
* And a great company restaurant and coffee bar with barista.


Contact  

If the challenging profile appeals to you, apply now by filling in the application form and uploading your CV and cover letter. For more information, please contact Robin Overweel - robin.overweel@vanderlande.com
company_description: Vanderlande is the global market leader for future-proof logistic process automation at airports and in the parcel market. We are also a leading supplier of process automation solutions for warehouses

title: NExTWORKx PhD position Co-Evolution of Telecommunication Networks and Urban systems
description:
NExTWORKx PhD position Co-Evolution of Telecommunication Networks and Urban systems
 Apply Now
Job description


NExTWORKx\* is the strategic partnership between the Telecom and ICT service provider KPN and Delft University of Technology. NExTWORKx aims to develop new concepts & technology in telecommunication and artificial intelligence, to respond to new disruptive technologies and to continue the development of talent. NExTWORKx enters its second research phase with a focus on developing and applying concepts from network science to model the huge number of real-time interactions between software components and data sets and to enable monitoring and control. AI-based algorithms will be developed for monitoring information flows and smart contracts. A trusted layer for monitoring and control is crucial for every network and digital infrastructure individually, but also across critical infrastructures, data sharing and smart city platforms. NExTWORKx announces the hiring of 4 PhD students who will be mentored by both TUDelft and KPN staff. The 4 PhD projects contribute to the above goals, but each with a different focus:



* Safe use of AI in telecommunication networks


* Resilient cross domain networks for critical infrastructure


* Secure data sharing in federated edge clouds


* Co-evolution of telecommunication networks and urban systems



**Co-evolution of telecommunication networks and urban systems****:** Many cities are implementing smart city projects, using Internet of Things (IoT) sensors and IoT analytics platforms to collect data on their infrastructure, processes and operations. This data is used to better manage resources, assets and services and improve operations (e.g. utilities, mobility). To support the digitization of cities the telecommunications networks also need to evolve in order to provide ubiquitous connectivity (5G/6G, fiber, LPWAN etc.), decentralised datacenter capabilities to optimize urban performance at the lowest possible cost and environmental impact (including energy consumption) and new network capabilities such as very precise location and timing services.



The key objective of this project is to discover how urban (digital) systems and telecommunications networks co-evolve. This is essential to 1) understand how the development of telecommunications network is driven by and at the same time facilitate the formation of our urban system, 2) identify telecom network development/planning that may further enhance the global telecom and urban performance from the perspective of economy, society and sustainability.



This PhD position will be based at the Multimedia Computing Group in the Department of Intelligent Systems (INSY).


* KPN and Delft University of Technology will work together on new ICT technologies (overons.kpn)


Requirements


We are looking for brilliant PhD candidates with a strong interest to the join a university-company collaboration on future Networking. The ideal candidate is multidisciplinary, well-versed in network science, complex systems, data science and telecommunications (protocols, architectures, design and performance). You also have an MSc degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Applied Mathematics, Applied Physics, or urbanism with specialisation in data analysis.



Because of project definitions, we are looking for EU citizens.



Doing a PhD at TU Delft requires English proficiency at a certain level to ensure that the candidate is able to communicate and interact well, participate in English-taught Doctoral Education courses, and write scientific articles and a final thesis. For more details please check the Graduate Schools Admission Requirements.


Conditions of employment


Doctoral candidates will be offered a 4-year period of employment in principle, but in the form of 2 employment contracts. An initial 1,5 year contract with an official go/no go progress assessment within 15 months. Followed by an additional contract for the remaining 2,5 years assuming everything goes well and performance requirements are met.



Salary and benefits are in accordance with the Collective Labour Agreement for Dutch Universities, increasing from € 2770 per month in the first year to € 3539 in the fourth year. As a PhD candidate you will be enrolled in the TU Delft Graduate School. The TU Delft Graduate School provides an inspiring research environment with an excellent team of supervisors, academic staff and a mentor. The Doctoral Education Programme is aimed at developing your transferable, discipline-related and research skills.



The TU Delft offers a customisable compensation package, discounts on health insurance, and a monthly work costs contribution. Flexible work schedules can be arranged.



For international applicants, TU Delft has the Coming to Delft Service. This service provides information for new international employees to help you prepare the relocation and to settle in the Netherlands. The Coming to Delft Service offers a Dual Career Programme for partners and they organise events to expand your (social) network.


TU Delft (Delft University of Technology)


Delft University of Technology is built on strong foundations. As creators of the world-famous Dutch waterworks and pioneers in biotech, TU Delft is a top international university combining science, engineering and design. It delivers world class results in education, research and innovation to address challenges in the areas of energy, climate, mobility, health and digital society. For generations, our engineers have proven to be entrepreneurial problem-solvers, both in business and in a social context.



At TU Delft we embrace diversity as one of our core values and we actively engage to be a university where you feel at home and can flourish. We value different perspectives and qualities. We believe this makes our work more innovative, the TU Delft community more vibrant and the world more just. Together, we imagine, invent and create solutions using technology to have a positive impact on a global scale. That is why we invite you to apply. Your application will receive fair consideration.



Challenge. Change. Impact!


Faculty Electrical Engineering, Mathematics and Computer Science


The Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Mathematics and Computer Science (EEMCS) brings together three scientific disciplines. Combined, they reinforce each other and are the driving force behind the technology we all use in our daily lives. Technology such as the electricity grid, which our faculty is helping to make completely sustainable and future-proof. At the same time, we are developing the chips and sensors of the future, whilst also setting the foundations for the software technologies to run on this new generation of equipment – which of course includes AI. Meanwhile we are pushing the limits of applied mathematics, for example mapping out disease processes using single cell data, and using mathematics to simulate gigantic ash plumes after a volcanic eruption. In other words: there is plenty of room at the faculty for ground-breaking research. We educate innovative engineers and have excellent labs and facilities that underline our strong international position. In total, more than 1000 employees and 4,000 students work and study in this innovative environment.



Click here to go to the website of the Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Mathematics and Computer Science.


Additional information


For more information about this position, please contact Dr. Huijuan Wang, e-mail: h.wang@tudelft.nl.


Application procedure


Are you interested in this vacancy? Please apply before **August 31, 2024** via the application button and upload the following documents to your application:



* A two-page motivation letter, explaining why you would like to work with us, your research interest, and experience related to the research field;


* Degree transcripts;


* An up-to-date CV;


* The names and contact information of at least three relevant references. We will not contact references without your consent.


* A pre-employment screening can be part of the selection procedure.
* You can apply online. We will not process applications sent by email and/or post.
* Please do not contact us for unsolicited services.


FACULTY/DEPARTMENT### **Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Mathematics & Computer Science**

JOB TYPE### **PhD**

SCIENTIFIC FIELD### **Engineering**

HOURS PER WEEK### **36-40**

SALARY### **€ 2.770,00 - € 3.539,00**

DESIRED LEVEL OF EDUCATION### **University graduate**

VACANCY NUMBER### **TUD05331**


Apply Now

title: Specialist Business Intelligence
description:
Functieomschrijving


Je bent verantwoordelijk voor het implementeren van de informatiestrategie voor de directie Finance. Je coördineert en begeleidt teams bij het ontwikkelen van geavanceerde datamodellen om financiële gegevens te analyseren, voorspellende inzichten te genereren en financiële prognoses te maken. Jouw expertise en coördinatie zorgen voor waardevolle data gedreven inzichten. Hiertoe werk je samen met procesanalisten, specialisten procesautomatisering en -ontwikkeling en informatie-analisten.



Je coördineert de ontwikkeling van data integriteit processen die nodig zijn om de juistheid, consistentie en format van een breed scala aan organisatiedata te borgen. Je initieert en onderhoudt een datacatalogus van geharmoniseerde en gestandaardiseerde datadefinities voor stamdata. Op basis van de business requirements van data uit de datacatalogus maak je een data- en informatiemodel. Daarnaast verzorg je de datavalidatie en coördinatie.



Behoeften en vereisten van de Finance organisatie vertaal je naar data/ informatie-gerelateerde oplossingen en aanbevelingen



Je zet een organisatiebrede datastrategie op met daaraan gekoppeld een datakwaliteitsproces. Tot slot ontwerp en onderhoud je eenduidige rollen en verantwoordelijkheden met betrekking tot data domeinen/groepen.



Met een brede set aan rapportages met business en performance analyses (KPI’s) help je het management in hun besluitvorming ten aanzien van de bedrijfsvoering


Functie-eisen


* Je hebt een hbo/wo opleiding bedrijfskundige informatica / BI analytics / big data scientist of equivalent daarvan afgerond.
* Je hebt ervaring met het ontwikkelen van een datamanagement raamwerk binnen een grote organisatie.
* Je hebt relevante MI / business intelligence analyse en software-ervaring.
* SQL / Python / Machine Learning.
* Je hebt de vaardigheid om grote en complexe projecten aan te sturen.
* Je hebt uitstekende analytische vaardigheden en neemt het initiatief om issues op te lossen.
* Je bent in staat om op begrijpelijk te communiceren over data.


Arbeidsvoorwaarden


* Het dienstverband is 1 jaar met uitzicht op vast.
* Een functieomvang van 36-40 uur per week.
* Een salaris dat is gebaseerd op schaal 11 uit de CAO Nederlandse Universiteiten met een minimum van €4.332,- en een maximum van €5.929,- bruto per maand op basis van een volledige werkweek (38 uur), plus 8% vakantiegeld en een eindejaarsuitkering van 8,3%.
* Een uitstekende pensioenregeling via het ABP.
* De mogelijkheid om jaarlijks een individueel arbeidsvoorwaardenpakket samen te stellen.
* Korting bij zorgverzekeraars.
* Flexibele werkweek.
* Jaarlijks 232 verlofuren (bij 38 uur). Via het individueel keuzebudget kun je bovendien verlofuren verkopen of bijkopen.
* Volop mogelijkheden om opleidingen, trainingen en cursussen te volgen.
* Gedeeltelijk doorbetaald ouderschapsverlof.
* Aandacht voor gezond en energiek werken met het vitaliteitsprogramma.


TU Delft


De Technische Universiteit Delft heeft een sterk fundament. Als bouwer van de wereldberoemde Nederlandse waterwerken en pionier in biotech is TU Delft een internationale topuniversiteit die wetenschap, engineering en design combineert. TU Delft staat voor onderwijs, onderzoek en innovatie van wereldklasse om uitdagingen op het gebied van energie, klimaat, mobiliteit, gezondheid en digitale maatschappij aan te gaan. Generaties Delftse ingenieurs hebben bewezen ondernemende probleemoplossers te zijn in bedrijfsleven en in sociale context.



Bij TU Delft omarmen we diversiteit als een van onze kernwaarden en zetten we ons actief in om een universiteit te zijn waar jij je thuis voelt en kunt floreren. We hechten veel waarde aan verschillende perspectieven en kwaliteiten, omdat wij geloven dat dit ons werk innovatiever, de TU Delft-gemeenschap levendiger en de wereld rechtvaardiger maakt. Samen bedenken en ontwikkelen we oplossingen die een positieve invloed hebben op wereldwijde schaal. Daarom nodigen we jou uit om te solliciteren. Je sollicitatie krijgt een eerlijke behandeling.



Challenge. Change. Impact!


Universiteitsdienst - Finance


De ambitie van de TU Delft vraagt om investeringen in onderzoek, techniek, en onderwijs, en dat zegt direct alles over het belang van Finance. Wij adviseren het College van Bestuur, de faculteiten en diensten over financiële vraagstukken op het gebied van business control, procurement, treasury management, fiscaliteiten en verzekeringen. Daarnaast zijn wij verantwoordelijk voor de planning- en controlcyclus en de gehele financiële administratie. Dit alles is onmisbaar voor de TU Delft om hun ambities waar te maken. Je bent van harte uitgenodigd om hiervan deel uit te maken.


Additionele informatie

title: Operations Data Engineer
description:
**3 redenen waarom dit jouw baan is**
-------------------------------------

* Jij hebt een sterke drive om met jouw data engineering en devops ervaring de generieke taken op het nieuwe dataplatform in Azure en beheer werkzaamheden uit te voeren.
* Je krijgt energie van het optimaliseren van dergelijke omgevingen.
* Jij wilt graag een bijdrage leveren aan een organisatie met een groot maatschappelijk belang.


**Jij doet het**
----------------


Als Operations Data Engineer zorg jij er mede voor dat de SVB waarde kan halen uit de beschikbare data. Jij stelt de collega’s die aan dataproducten werken in staat hun werk zo goed mogelijk te doen binnen de geformuleerde kaders. Als Operations Data Engineer zorg je ervoor dat collega’s van het Service Center Data (SCD) op efficiënte wijze data producten kunnen ontwikkelen, bijvoorbeeld rapportages of het doen van analytische onderzoeken. Het betreft een nieuwe rol binnen het SCD die gedurende het huidige lopende project FIT4Data is ontstaan. De rol is nog in ontwikkeling en met jouw input kunnen we daar ook nog verder invulling aan geven. Jij werkt mee in het project waarna je de uiteindelijke rol zult vervullen binnen het SCD.


Op dit moment zien we de volgende activiteiten op het Dataplatform binnen Azure:


* Je zorgt er voor dat de complete CI/CD straat optimaal wordt ingericht, zodat dataproducten gecontroleerd naar productie gebracht kunnen worden.
* Je beheert de OTAP straten middels Infrastructure as Code (Bicep)
* Je beheert de verschillende data domeinen waar brondata ontvangen kan worden
* Je monitort proactief en reactief de performance
* Je bent alert op kostenfluctuaties
* Je voelt je verantwoordelijk voor het juist configureren van rechten
* Je stelt documentatie op voor vastlegging, uitvoering en beheer van de Way of Working


En verder:


* Je ondersteunt de BI-, analytics- en engineeringteams rondom scheduling, loadplans, etc.
* Het inrichten en beheer van omgevingen die niet in Azure komen, zoals bv Power BI.
* Je bent flexibel en bereid om ook andere zaken en werkzaamheden op te pakken indien dat binnen het team nodig is (T-Shaped).


Je maakt deel uit van ons onderdeel IT Diensten Bedrijfsvoering en Staven.( Wij blinken uit in het leveren van generieke IT componenten, werkplek- en applicatiediensten voor de gehele SVB en zorgen er zo voor dat de medewerker zijn werkzaamheden voor de publieke taak optimaal kan uitvoeren.’ ) We zorgen ervoor dat onze klanten krijgen waar ze recht op hebben. Ook informeren we onze klanten over mogelijke veranderingen. Digitaal waar kan en persoonlijk waar nodig. Samen met onze partners en met collega’s die het verschil maken. Zoals jij.


Je maakt deel uit van ons onderdeel IT dat verantwoordelijk is voor alle technologie binnen de SVB. Met 6 IT-afdelingen ontwikkelen en onderhouden we onze softwaresystemen. Zo maken wij applicaties in het hele spectrum: soms klein, soms voor miljoenen klanten. We zorgen er natuurlijk ook voor dat alles 24/7 in de lucht blijft op onze complexe infrastructuur. Samen met onze partners en met collega’s die het verschil maken. Zoals jij.


**Jij bent het**
----------------


Een enthousiast teamlid, iemand die durft ‘out-of-the-box' te denken. Je werkt in een Agile team. Oplossingsrichtingen bedenk je samen met jouw team én met andere teams binnen de organisatie. Je neemt ook actief deel aan het SCD scrum proces.


* Je hebt een flexibele en klantgerichte instelling en je bent communicatief zeer vaardig.
* Je bent sterk in probleemanalyse en je kunt oplossingsgericht werken.
* Je bent een teamplayer die ook goed in staat is om zelfstandig te werken.
* Je hebt bij voorkeur een informatica opleiding op HBO niveau afgerond en je hebt aantoonbare ervaring in een soortgelijke functie.
* Je hebt ervaring met Azure Devops (CI/CD YAML-pipelines), Synapse, SQL, Python, Powershell.
* Kennis van ITIL-processen, Agile, en informatiebeveiliging is van harte welkom.

**Welke kansen bieden we jou?**
-------------------------------


Je krijgt alles wat nodig is om je functie goed uit te voeren. Jouw uitdaging, balans en groei: het heeft onze aandacht. Kansen en mogelijkheden om te groeien als persoon en als professional zijn er genoeg. Aan jou de taak om ze te pakken. Bovendien kan jij (op basis van een 36-urige werkweek) ook rekenen op een bruto maandsalaris tot maximaal € 5.336,- euro (schaal 8). Inschaling is op basis van ervaring en geschiktheid. Het betreft een functie voor 32-36 uur.


Meer informatie over secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden (vergoedingen, pensioen en opleidingsbudget) vind je **hier**.


**Jouw werkomgeving**
---------------------


Van kinderbijslag tot AOW-pensioen: wij betalen namens de overheid de volksverzekeringen uit. Elk jaar gaat het om 50 miljard euro die we overmaken aan zo'n 5,7 miljoen klanten. Op tijd, eerlijk en efficiënt.


Vanaf 11 locaties maken we ons sterk voor de beste dienstverlening aan onze klanten. Dit doen we met zo'n 4.000 betrokken en kundige collega's. De teams vullen elkaar aan en maken zo samen het verschil. Een baan bij de SVB biedt kansen voor denkers en doeners met initiatief.


*Thuis werken of op kantoor? Bij de SVB noemen we dit 'Bewust Werken'. Dit gaat verder dan alleen een afweging maken tussen werken op kantoor of thuis (hybride). Met Bewust Werken maak je in overleg met je team en leidinggevende een professionele en bewuste afweging over hoe, waar, wanneer, met wie en met welke middelen jij jouw resultaten optimaal kunt behalen, zowel kwalitatief als kwantitatief. Hierin staat niet alleen het klantbelang voorop maar worden ook de belangen van onze organisatie, de teams en de medewerkers meegewogen. Er is geen dicht getimmerd plan, maar we willen Bewust Werken realiseren door te experimenteren en te leren.*


**Meer weten?**
---------------


Wil je eerst nog meer informatie? Neem contact op met Tommi Cuturic (Senior IT Recruiter) via 0628235592 of tcuturic@svb.nl


**Solliciteren: jij pakt deze kans**
------------------------------------


Graag, solliciteer direct!


**Opmerking acquisitie en VOG**
-------------------------------


Acquisitie wordt voor deze vacature niet op prijs gesteld.


Een VOG screening maakt onderdeel uit van de sollicitatieprocedure.
company_addresses: Je vindt ons in Amstelveen (hoofdkantoor), Breda, Deventer, Groningen, Leiden, Nijmegen, Roermond, Rotterdam, Utrecht (2x) en Zaanstad.

title: Information analyst
description:
+ 3-5 years

+ 32 - 40 uur
+ Data

+ €70.000 - €95.000


* You will become part of the frontrunner in the energy transition, where you contribute to a more sustainable future by building on the growth and development of Eneco's integration platforms
* You know how to transform ideas into realization
* You will implement the desired Data & Analytics solution(s) that will be realized on our state of the art data platform

Why choose for Eneco?
Why choose Eneco? We want to accelerate the energy transition. With our ambitious ‘One Planet plan’, we have made it clear that by 2035, we aim to be the first energy company to become CO2-neutral. No more reliance on natural gas! The entire Netherlands is making the switch. Towards smarter, cleaner, and more sustainable energy. Everyone has their own reasons for doing so. Some want to contribute to a better climate, others switch because their neighbors are doing it, or because they find joy in saving energy, and we're doing it now!


At Eneco, we want to help everyone to take the next sustainable step. And we are looking for the best people who can make that possible. People who are enthusiastic about our mission of 'sustainable energy for everyone' and who want to further develop their talents at Eneco. We want everyone to be able to participate effortlessly in the energy transition. This can only happen if we better assist our customers, remove barriers for them to become more sustainable by listening and understanding their true needs.


Digital innovations help the market align supply and demand and make it as easy as possible for users. Data plays a crucial role in this. From the Data & Technology Services department, we are working to make Eneco a data-driven organization that bases its decisions and actions on customer, product, asset, and market data.


What you’ll do
Our Data Services department is responsible for executing data projects for the Business and fueling the growth of data capabilities by acting as an incubator for the development of data products. You have a pivotal role in multiple projects.

* You translate the requirements from the Business into data driven solutions where you'll be designing data models (e.g., Canonical, Data Vault, Data Mart) that supports these requirements.
* Activities of the Data Analyst are primarily scoped on translating data, reporting and dashboard requirements to suitable data & analytics solutions for business usage.
* The Data Analyst is a critical thinker who keeps on asking 'why' questions until it is completely clear what the Business wants to achieve.

Is this about you?* At least 5 years of relevant experience as a data or information analyst
* Strong experience with SQL, preferably also experience with Snowflake
* Deep understanding of business concepts, processes and data entities
* Solid experience with discussing functional requirements, designing data vauilt/marts and translating to technical requirements
* Extensive knowledge and experience with the application of data concepts, data models and data warehouse concepts
* Excellent communication skills and good command of the English language, spoken and written

You’ll be responsible for* Drafting and proposing business requirements and (non) functional requirements regarding required data products.
* Translates requirements into appropriate functional specifications and functional designs into Data & Analytics solutions and, where necessary, applies prototyping as a basis for business acceptance and technical implementation of the data solutions.
* Designing (logical) data models in line with Eneco's Canonical Data Model to support the realization or adjustment of the (technical) data models (Data Vault, Data Marts) in our data platform.
* Providing stakeholders with proactive advice on new or existing data solutions and, together with architecture, ensures the application of the correct solution direction.

This is where you’ll work
Data & Technology Services has multiple departments; Data Services has 3 teams – an enterprise datamanagement team, a data analytics team and a data engineer team. You will be part of the data analytics team that assist the business in using the various parts of the Enterprise Data Platform effectively to create customer and business value.


What we have to offer
Gross annual salary between €70.000 and €95.000


Including 8% holiday allowance, a good pension and parental leave.
FlexBudget on top of your gross salary


Have it paid out, use it to buy extra holiday days or save it up for something nice - it's up to you.
Personal and professional growth


Eneco is fully committed to help you in your personal and professional development.
Hybrid working, at home or in the office


You work 40% at the office and 40% at home. The other day you decide what works best for you.
View more
Work that works for you and the climate
If you decide on a career at Eneco, you are choosing ambition, growth and opportunities. You will have all the space you want to improve yourself and do your job the way that suits you best, which includes having a good work-life balance. You can work to a flexible schedule and work partly from home if your role allows it.
That is how you can work on your own future and on the future of the world. After all, you and your 4,000 colleagues are committed to our mission: climate neutrality by 2035. We assist customers to accelerate their sustainability efforts, devise innovative solutions and seize opportunities with both hands. Are you ready?
The stages of our application procedure:


Stap 1


Your application
Stap 2


We carefully review your application
Stap 3


We invite you for a 1st (online) interview
Stap 4


Sometimes we want to get to know you even better, then there will be an online assessment and a 2nd interview
Stap 5


Yes! If it’s a match and if you agree, the recruiter will happily discuss your job offer
Want to know more about this job function?
We understand that you may want to learn more before taking the next step in your career. Therefore, we encourage you to reach out to our recruiter, Mark van Dommelen. Whether you have questions about the interview process, the specific duties and responsibilities of the role, or are simply curious about the company culture, we are here to answer all your inquiries.  

  

**For the recruitment of this position, we prefer to handle the process internally and do not wish to collaborate with external parties.**
