title: Data Engineer
description:
**Data Engineer**
=================


Ervaring: Expert
  

Locatie: Breda
Als Data Engineer heb je een sterke interesse in Cloud Data Architecture, SQL, ETL Operations en Data Development, naast zeer sterke analytische en kritische denkvaardigheden. Ons Analytics & Insights-team zorgt voor het ontwerp, de ontwikkeling en deployment van data pipelines bij onze klanten.

  


Projecten variëren van technische data-architectuuropdrachten, data pipeline ontwerp en deployment, datamigratieprojecten en ondersteunende taken. Je werkt nauw samen met onze klanten, Data Architects, -Analysts en hun -Engineering collega's. Je combineert projecten en deadlines van verschillende klanten en sectoren.

  


Deze rol biedt je kansen voor het verder ontwikkelen van vaardigheden binnen data en analytics. Je maakt deel uit van een team dat zich richt op het helpen van klanten bij het aanpakken van hun data-uitdagingen.

  


Afbeelding
**Hoe ziet jouw dag eruit?**
----------------------------


Als data engineer voer je volgende taken uit:  



* Je werkt mee aan de ontwikkeling van strategieën, roadmaps en business cases voor Analytics en BI oplossingen.
* Je neemt deel aan de volledige levenscyclus van een analyse- of BI-project: van het verzamelen en begrijpen van de analysebehoeften van de eindgebruiker, het bedenken van de oplossing, over het functionele ontwerp, het gedetailleerde technische ontwerp, de implementatie tot het voorbereiden en uitvoeren van de functionele en producttests vóór de oplevering.
* Je ontwerpt en zet dataplatformen (datawarehouse/data lakes) op, zowel on-premise als in de cloud.
* Je beschrijft en brengt gegevens van verschillende bronsystemen in kaart om gegevensopslag te targeten.
* Je stelt ETL- en ELT-pipelines in om gegevens te extraheren, te transformeren en te laden.
* Je installeert, configureert en optimaliseert dataservices (datawarehouse, in-memory analytics-databases, ...).
* Je bouwt en onderhoudt de klantrelatie binnen IT of de business.
**Wat kun je van ons verwachten?**
----------------------------------


Naast een leuke, informele en flexibele werkomgeving met tal van activiteiten voor medewerkers, kom je terecht in het **#one.axi.team** en bieden we jou het volgende:

  


* We werken binnen AXI hybride. Dit betekent dat je zowel vanuit onze moderne ingerichte kantoren in Breda, Aartselaar, Willebroek of Gent kan werken of van thuis uit.
* Ook tijdens het thuiswerken zorgen we voor een comfortabele werkplek.
* We bieden je een aantrekkelijk loonpakket met een bedrijfsauto en tankkaart.
* Je komt terecht in een aangename, informele en flexibele werkomgeving.
* Samen stellen we een persoonlijk ontwikkelingsplan op. Regelmatig volg je opleidingen en workshops vanuit onze AXI Academy.
Ben jij op zoek naar AXI in je job?
**Word onze nieuwe Data Engineer**
----------------------------------


**Wat verwachten we van jou?**
------------------------------


**Je technische skills**

  


* Je hebt een goed begrip van verschillende databronnen in diverse bestandsformaten zoals csv, json, parquet,.. , streaming data en databases (SQL Server, PostgreSQL, Oracle, MySQL, ...).
* Je hebt kennis van het Microsoft Azure Data Platform (Azure SQL, Azure Synapse, Azure Analysis Services, Data Factory, Azure (Data Lake) Storage, ...).
* Je hebt kennis van SQL / T-SQL, PLSQL en Python.
* Je bent bekend met Databricks en Fabric
* Kennis van Linux en Powershell, SQL Server (SSIS, SSRS, SSAS) en de bijbehorende data-analyse talen (SQL, DAX) of Azure Devops in combinatie met CI/CD is een pluspunt
**Je soft skills**

  


* Je bent een teamspeler ook ondernemend, analytisch en flexibel.
* Je bent leergierig en groeit graag
* Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden zijn essentieel, je beheerst technische ICT-taal, maar kan ook zakelijke en niet-ICT-stakeholders overtuigen.
**Je diploma**

  


* Professionele bachelor of gelijkwaardig door ervaring.


**Je taalvaardigheid**

  


* Nederlands en goede kennis van het Engels.
**Hoe pakken wij jouw sollicitatie concreet aan?**
--------------------------------------------------


Je voelt aan dat deze job prima bij je past? Solliciteren bij AXI loopt als volgt:

  


* **Nadat we je sollicitatieformulier ontvangen hebben, gaan we direct aan de slag. We bekijken jouw cv aandachtig**  

Als je profiel aansluit bij de vacature of een van de andere job opportuniteiten, nodigen wij je graag uit voor een oriëntatiegesprek met onze recruitment manager. Het oriëntatiegesprek is een open gesprek met jou: over wie je bent, wat je talenten en ambities zijn en wat je voor AXI wil betekenen. Als we samen besluiten om een volgende stap te zetten, gaan we de tweede ronde in. Je praat met je toekomstige manager en krijgt de kans om met toekomstige collega's te praten. Akkoord met ons voorstel? Welkom bij AXI.
* **Feedback zekerheid**  

Je mag er op rekenen dat we je snel een duidelijke feedback geven over je sollicitatie.
* **Vragen?**  

Stuur naar jobs@axi.nl of jobs@axi.be
**Over AXI**
------------


AXI is een allround IT partner in België en Nederland met meer dan 400 medewerkers en kantoren te Breda, Aartselaar, Willebroek, en Gent.

  


We denken en werken strategisch, steeds gericht op het vinden van de meest optimale en duurzame oplossing voor de unieke behoeften van onze klanten.

  


**We zijn steeds op zoek naar nieuw talent in de voortdurend transformerende IT wereld.**

  


Bij AXI word je gestimuleerd om expertise uit te bouwen door opleidingen, trainingen en ervaringen. Je kennis deel je graag met collega's, zowel binnen je eigen team als over teams en functies heen, want van elkaar kunnen we echt leren.

  


Dankzij jouw persoonlijk ontwikkelingsplan krijg je bovendien de ruimte om je eigen skills en kennis steeds verder te ontwikkelen en zo je loopbaan zelf te sturen.

  


Heb je interesse? Mail dan zeker naar jobs@axi.nl of jobs@axi.be

title: Junior Data & Analytics Specialist
description:
Full-time / Part-time · Hub Eindhoven


**Als Junior Data & Analytics Specialist ben je…**
--------------------------------------------------



onderdeel van een divers data team (7 collega’s) met een mooie mix aan senioriteit én startende professionals. Dit zorgt ervoor dat we elkaar als team kunnen blijven uitdagen, maar belangrijker nog: elkaar verder helpen in onze ontwikkeling. Er zijn verschillende specialismen in het team: Data & Analytics Specialist, Data Consultant, Data Engineer en een Data Analyst.

  

**Wat doen de verschillende specialisten binnen het team?**


* Data & Analytics Specialist: is verantwoordelijk voor het adviseren, implementeren, beheren en optimaliseren van analytics tools en tag management oplossingen.
* Data Consultant: adviseert klanten op het gebied van data. Vertaalt na een analyse van het datalandschap de doelstellingen van een klant door naar een heldere data strategie en roadmap die helpt om die doelstellingen te realiseren.
* Data Engineer: zorgt ervoor dat alle benodigde data toegankelijk en analyseerbaar is, en voorziet in de benodigde technische infrastructuur.
* Data Analyst: is verantwoordelijk voor data analyses en het visualiseren van data in data visualisatie tools zoals Looker Studio en Tableau.


Binnen het team zijn ook mogelijkheden om jezelf (op termijn) richting een van de **andere disciplines** verder **te ontwikkelen**.



Als Junior Data & Analytics Specialist ben je verantwoordelijk voor het adviseren, implementeren, beheren en optimaliseren van analytics tools en tag management oplossingen. Je biedt technische ondersteuning aan klanten en collega’s en implementeert tracking tools zoals **Google Analytics** en tag management oplossingen zoals **Google Tag Manager** om websites en apps effectief te meten.



Om de juiste oplossingen voor klanten te creëren werk je samen met specialisten vanuit verschillende digitale marketingkanalen, developers en het team aan klantzijde. Je zult bijdragen aan de vertaling van de marketing- en/of datadoelstellingen naar technische eisen door het opstellen van een meetplan. Je werkt hierbij samen met een ervaren Data & Analytics Consultant. Jullie starten vaak met een audit van de bestaande tag management en analytics implementatie gevolgd door een plan van aanpak met daarin de benodigde aanpassingen.


**Wat breng je mee?**
---------------------



Idealiter beschik je al over ervaring binnen het Data & Analytics domein, maar we staan ook open voor andere relevante ervaringen. Hoe ziet onze ideale kandidaat eruit:


* Afgeronde HBO of WO opleiding in de richting van Marketing (Analytics), Commerciële Economie, ICT, Informatica of een verwant technisch vakgebied.
* Je kunt zelfstandig te werk gaan en bent zorgvuldig.
* Je bent een teamplayer, die ook graag even een praatje maakt met je collega’s.
* Je hebt ervaring in Google Tag Manager, Google Analytics en/of BigQuery of je wil dit graag leren.
* Je hebt ervaring met Data Layers, HTML, CSS of Javascript of je wil dit graag leren.


**Vrijheid, verantwoordelijkheid en vertrouwen..**
==================================================



Dat zijn niet alleen onze kernwaarden, maar ook de basisingrediënten voor een succesvolle samenwerking. We gaan uit van vertrouwen. Bij Happy Horizon krijg én neem je de vrijheid om zaken te regelen zodat het werkt voor jezelf, je team en onze klanten. Wij durven onze verantwoordelijkheid te pakken en beslissingen te nemen. En dat verwachten we dus ook van jou. Gelukkig is dat voor jou vanzelfsprekend toch? ;)

**Paul**



Data Specialist

  


**Victor**



Director Innovations

  


**Maarten**



Teamlead

  


**Jij?**



Data Specialist



**Wat kan je van ons verwachten?**
----------------------------------



Werken bij Happy Horizon betekent dat je terecht komt in een omgeving met tal van kansen op verschillende vlakken. Onze wereld is dynamisch en staat nooit stil. Samen ontdekken we jouw horizon en de weg daar naartoe. Daarnaast bieden wij:


* Geld natuurlijk. Maar daarnaast nog veel meer
* Een team met senior data specialisten om van te leren
* Aandacht voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling via ons Groeihuis
* Een inspirerende werkomgeving waarin innovatie, samenwerking, plezier en resultaat centraal staan
* Flexibele werktijden met de mogelijkheid om hybride te werken
* Werken aan verschillende projecten met een diversiteit aan uitdagingen en specialismen
* Enthousiaste collega's, waarbij veel ruimte is voor eigen ideeën en waar je bijdrage werkelijk op prijs wordt gesteld
* Mogelijkheden om je te blijven ontwikkelen door ons speciaal ontwikkelde talentprogramma


**Interesse?**
==============



Zit je inmiddels op het puntje van je stoel? Of voel je gewoon dat deze functie jou op het lijf is geschreven? Stuur dan je CV via een van onderstaande opties!  

En die motivatiebrief? Niet verplicht, maar verras ons vooral met een creatieve sollicitatie ;-)


**Toch nog even een vraagje..**
===============================



Heb je nog vragen of ben je nieuwsgierig naar iets? Mail, Whatsapp of bel **Willem** dan even. Vindt hij nog gezellig ook.



 willempeters@happyhorizon.com  

 06 39 04 75 03

title: data engineer
description:
* geplaatst op 10 juli 2024 om 16:06

Wij zoeken een data engineer voor 36 uur per week


**Waar kom je te werken?**
--------------------------



Je werkt als data engineer samen met data scientisten, - analisten, -integratie -architecten en BI-specialisten. Maar ook samen met experts van de business, archivering, informatiebeveiliging en -kwaliteit.



Jouw theoretische kennis en werkervaring gebruik je om samen met jouw collega’s een keuze te maken uit de beste oplossingen, tools en methodieken die nodig zijn voor het geautomatiseerd ontsluiten, modelleren en transformeren van data en het creëren van de juiste inzichten voor de organisatie.



Je biedt de organisatie de mogelijkheid om effectiever gebruik te maken van data; door het koppelen, organiseren en ontsluiten van data. Hierbij wordt onder andere gebruik gemaakt van de mogelijkheden van het Azure platform. Het ontwikkelen van scripts en algoritmes is essentieel voor het bij elkaar brengen en organiseren van de data.


**Wat ga jij doen?**
--------------------


**Jij…**


* bent aanspreekpunt op het gebied van het opnemen van data in het datalakehouse.
* hebt een grote rol in het verfijnen van de klantwensen op zowel technisch als functioneel niveau.
* bent ontwikkelaar van een modern datalakehouse binnen het Azure platform.
* zorgt dat de data uit de bronapplicaties op een betrouwbare manier in het datalakehouse terecht komt, zorgt voor een logische datastructuur en bent verantwoordelijk voor het beheer.
* signaleert problemen met de kwaliteit van data in de bronsystemen en voert hier gesprekken over.

**Wie ben jij?**
----------------


**Jij…**


* beschikt over hbo werk- en denkniveau aangevuld met enkele jaren relevante werkervaring.
* hebt ervaring in programmeren in Python en Spark (dataframes).
* hebt kennis van en ervaring met verschillende soorten databases en technologieën, databronnen en -formaten.
* hebt kennis op het gebied van het Azure platform, bijvoorbeeld Azure Synapse Analytics en/of soortgelijke technieken zoals Databricks.
* hebt ervaring met agile werken, ETL en analytische tooling zoals PowerBI.
* bent communicatief vaardig, analytisch en resultaatgericht.
* bent bekend met de laatste ontwikkelingen op je vakgebied.

**Als Wetterskipper krijg je**
------------------------------


* vertrouwen, verantwoordelijkheid en de ruimte om je werk op jouw manier in te vullen.
* verrassend veel loopbaankansen in een organisatie met duizend-en-één expertises.
* een unieke werkomgeving en bevlogen collega’s, die betrokken zijn bij hun werk én bij elkaar.

**Wat bieden we jou?**
----------------------


* een bruto maandsalaris van minimaal € 3.952,- en maximaal € 5.376,- (schaal 10 cao werken voor waterschappen per juli 2024, bij een volledige werkweek van 36 uur), afhankelijk van opleiding en ervaring.
* een dienstverband van een jaar. Bij goed functioneren is het mogelijk dat na dat eerste jaar een contract voor onbepaalde tijd volgt.
* een individueel keuzebudget (IKB). Het IKB bedraagt 21 procent van het brutosalaris en kun je laten uitbetalen of er extra verlof voor kopen.
* een eigen opleidingsbudget van minimaal € 6.000,-. Dit budget is voor een periode van vijf jaar. Persoonlijke ambitie en ontwikkeling vinden wij namelijk erg belangrijk.
* uitstekende mogelijkheden voor een goede balans tussen werk en privé. Naast variabele werktijden kun je ook thuiswerken. We faciliteren dit met een thuiswerkbudget van € 850,- waarmee je thuis je werkplek arboproof kunt inrichten. Om op elke plek je werk goed te kunnen doen krijg je een laptop en een telefoon.
* een reiskostenvergoeding woon-werk van € 0,23 per kilometer wanneer je op je standplaats werkt of een thuiswerkvergoeding van € 3,- per dag wanneer je thuiswerkt.
* een pensioen bij het ABP. Daarnaast kun je met korting een aanvullende zorgverzekering of een arbeidsongeschiktheidsverzekering afsluiten.

**Wil je meer weten over deze functie?**
----------------------------------------



Neem dan contact op met Friso Akkerman, vakgroepleider IM ICT telefoon 06-136 77388


**Is dit jouw volgende baan?**
------------------------------



Dan horen we graag van jou! Stuur een email met cv en motivatie naar:



sollicitaties.071983@sollicitaties.werkeninfriesland.nl



Je kunt uiterlijk tot en met zondag 28 juli 2024 solliciteren.



Als je bij ons komt werken, moet je een verklaring omtrent gedrag inleveren.



De sollicitatiegesprekken houden we op donderdag 1 augustus.

title: Customer Journey Expert – Assisted Channels NL
description:
Working in the Assisted Channels NL area within our tribe means working in in a dynamic environment. With thousands of employees using our services every day, we are responsible for stable, secure, user-friendly and innovative tooling in all assisted channels including call- and chatbots. We ensure that our customers and employees always have the best experience supported by one generic global assisted channels toolkit. Therefore, we work closely together with the Global Assisted Platform (As global provider of the assisted toolkit), our Belgian Assisted Channels colleagues (for CRM), and Global Analytics (for our current chatbot and GenAI), and many other Tribes that contribute to the assisted channels for NL users. And of course with all employee user groups, from branches and ISPs to the advisors and relationship managers serving our different product and segment needs. The purpose of our area is: “We are passionate about our employees so they can delight our customers.”. From UX designer to IT engineer, we all work towards the same goal.


Iris is the global platform for all advisory, contact centers and back-offices employees to handle every customer demand with ease. Iris should provide an seamless and reliable experience supporting our employees in their daily work interacting with customers. And while the core of Iris is run by our Global Assisted Platform Area, The Iris NL Product team is responsible for:


the local implementation of Iris in NL incl support to other tribes and NL user groups the development and improvement of specific NL-owned Iris features such as the NL Product Overview and Product Details tiles in IRIS as well as Financial Overview a.k.a. Plan Ahead, our omnichannel tooling to provide overviews and insights on how a household is doing financially, now and in the future the CRM roadmap for ING NL, where the aim is to integrate the required CRM capabilities in IRIS (currently partially in Salesforce) in order to offer a better user experience (no more 2 applications with data sync issues).


We are looking for a CJE with broad affinity with Assisted Channels in NL, its users and their end-2-end journeys. But a special interest in CRM journeys across the different user groups and how these translate to (future) needs for the development of the new CRM capabilities.

**Your key responsibilities:**


These elements will surely be part of your work:

* Understanding both the user group journeys and needs in the context of CRM as well as a thorough understanding of CRM capabilities (e.g. Lead management, Reporting, 360 view, etc.), processes and how these should work together
* Creating the requirements for the solution to be developed, based on your thorough understanding of business needs and technical possibilities
* Proactively collaborating with other squads – mainly outside our area - to ensure timely deliveries of high-quality CRM features
* Maintain good relations with stakeholders within and outside our tribe

**Do you recognize yourself in this profile?**

* You’re passionate about providing employees the highest standard of tooling we can offer
* You have strong affinity with the value and complexity of CRM capabilities
* You are a naturally collaborative person who listens and invests in others to achieve common goals.
* You love to challenge the status quo and propose creative solutions.
* You are always a step ahead leveraging strong planning and analytical thinking skills
* You have strong experience delivering end to end customer journeys based on PACE methodology into specific patterns, requirements and user stories
* You have strong agile delivery skills
* You have strong experience working in a bus-dev-ops environment: you are able to work together with colleagues with different IT skills to translate requirements into proposed solution design and make sure IT-development can be properly done
* You strive to bring improvement everyday: whether it is in (y)our journeys or in (y)our own way of working. In doing so, you show strong self-reflection and follow-up
* You are analytical and driven by data rather than gut feeling
* Master’s or bachelor’s degree with relevant experience
* You are fluent in English

**Rewards and benefits**


We want to make sure that it’s possible for you to strike the right balance between your career and your private life. You can find out more about our employment conditions at https://www.ing.jobs/netherlands/Why-ING/benefits.htm


The benefits of working with us at ING include:

* A salary tailored to your qualities and experience
* 24-27 vacation days depending on contract
* Pension scheme
* 13th month salary
* Individual Savings Contribution (BIS), 3.5% of your gross annual salary
* 8% Holiday payment
* Hybrid working to blend home working for focus and office working for collaboration and co-creation
* Personal growth and challenging work with endless possibilities
* An informal working environment with innovative colleagues

**About us**


With 60,000 employees and operations in approximately 40 countries, there is no shortage of opportunities for people with initiative who want to help people take a step ahead in life and in business. Do you want to work at the cutting edge of what’s possible and at the same time ensure you work with integrity and hold the customer’s interests at heart? Do you want to be surrounded by progressive, inspiring, diverse and supportive colleagues? Then there is no better place to invest your talents than at ING. Join us. Apply today.

**Questions?**


Want to apply directly? Please upload your CV and motivation letter by clicking the “Apply” button. Please note, multiple interview steps involving various business stakeholders will be part of the selection process. If you would like more information in advance or if you have any questions, you can contact jeroen.maassen.van.den.brink@ing.com.

**Ready to apply?**

Please note that we are happy to receive your application in English. Please add a recent CV plus cover letter in which you explain why you are the one we need for our area. We look forward to meeting you!
company_description: With 9 million account holders, ING is one of the largest and most prominent financial service providers in the Netherlands. We are part of ING Group, a global financial institution.
ceo_name: Steven van Rijswijk, CEO ING Group

title: Customer Service Representative (German Speaking)
description:
For our Export markets we are in search of a Customer Service Representative (German Speaking) who is knowledgeable and experienced with the day-to-day order to cash process providing assistance and support to ensure a positive customer experience. The CSR will handle inquiries, resolve issues, and communicate effectively to meet customer needs.



What We’re Looking For


* You’re an empathetic and friendly person.
* You’re structured, analytically independent, and have a solutions-oriented mindset.
* You’re a problem solver and not afraid to ask questions with your investigative nature.
* You’re able to work with different types of processes and multiple tools to get the most out of your job.
* You enjoy working in a multicultural team.
* Fluent in English & German - Spoken & Written.


What You’ll Be Doing


* Handle internal & external customer inquiries quotes & orders in an efficient, accurate and professional manner for the DACH and Benelux markets.
* Be the main contact person for disputes management regarding orders orders for the DACH and Benelux markets, using strong analytic and organization skills you will fix these issues.
* Have an advanced understanding of EDI, web portal orders + invoicing.
* Responsible for building strong customer relationships and delivering customer-centric solutions.
* With Initial Direction & Supervision, take on new opportunities and tough challenges with a sense of urgency, high energy, and enthusiasm.
* Work with internal teams (ie: logistics, finance, sales, service engineers, senior leaders) with a high sense of accountability.


Our Needs


* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent HBO thinking + performance skills
* (Near) Native English, German and Dutch; any other EU language is a pre.
* Work experience (2+ years in Customer Service or Customer support)
* Knowledge of ERP system: Sale Force and SAP is a pre.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills.
* Detail orientated.
* Working knowledge of Excel


Preferred Skills:

  


* Customer orientation and ability to adapt/respond to different types of queries + situations.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills
* Ability to multi-task, prioritize, and manage time effectively.
* Any other major European language
* Understanding of the medical market + products
* High level of responsibility and efficiency when working and communicating.
* Working knowledge with SAP

  

**Fortive Corporation Overview**

  

Fortive’s essential technology makes the world stronger, safer, and smarter. We accelerate transformation across a broad range of applications including environmental, health and safety compliance, industrial condition monitoring, next-generation product design, and healthcare safety solutions.

  

We are a global industrial technology innovator with a startup spirit. Our forward-looking companies lead the way in software-powered workflow solutions, data-driven intelligence, AI-powered automation, and other disruptive technologies. We’re a force for progress, working alongside our customers and partners to solve challenges on a global scale, from workplace safety in the most demanding conditions to groundbreaking sustainability solutions.

  

We are a diverse team 18,000 strong, united by a dynamic, inclusive culture and energized by limitless learning and growth. We use the proven Fortive Business System (FBS) to accelerate our positive impact.

  

At Fortive, we believe in you. We believe in your potential—your ability to learn, grow, and make a difference.

  

At Fortive, we believe in us. We believe in the power of people working together to solve problems no one could solve alone.

  

Fortive: For you, for us, for growth.


  

No
  

ASP is a leading global provider of innovative sterilization and disinfection solutions, and a pioneer of low-temperature hydrogen peroxide sterilization technology.ASP’s mission is to protect patients during their most critical moments. We support healthcare facilities in the fight to protect patients against hospital acquired infections, which are a leading cause of morbidity and mortality. ASP’s products, which are sold globally, include the STERRAD system for sterilizing instruments and the EVOTECH and ENDOCLENS systems for endoscope reprocessing and cleaning. We Are an Equal Opportunity Employer. Fortive Corporation and all Fortive Companies are proud to be equal opportunity employers. We value and encourage diversity and solicit applications from all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, age, marital status, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or other characteristics protected by law. Fortive and all Fortive Companies are also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for applicants with disabilities. Individuals who need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment application process, please contact us at applyassistance@fortive.com.

title: Medior Google Cloud Data Engineer
description:
- If you like these keywords you’ll love this role:


#coding #cloud #python #data #linux


Our mission is to build cultures of innovation at companies by transforming the way they work, by modernising their IT infrastructure & apps, and by elevating their customer experiences. As a Premier Google Cloud partner, we do this by implementing innovative Google Cloud solutions and by leveraging cutting-edge AI & Machine Learning technologies.
  

  

Devoteam G Cloud’s certified Cloud engineers build disruptive solutions on Google Cloud Platform to give organisations a competitive advantage. We migrate and modernise legacy applications & IT infrastructure using Cloud Native solutions such as Kubernetes, Anthos and Serverless solutions.
  

  

We help our customers with their hybrid- and multi-Cloud strategies and to get to actionable business insights faster, by accelerating their data & analytics. Together we create scalable, future-proof & secure data journeys. And we build AI & ML solutions on top of this data to help customers to create better customer experiences. Next to that, we give the workplace of the future shape with solutions like Google Workspace.

  
With a team of Software Engineers you will take off on a journey to create a strategic product to facilitate and accelerate customer solutions on Google Cloud. You engineer based on the requirements of the project, but you are also not afraid to suggest solutions and propose your own ideas. You are a Google Cloud Expert, or are looking to become one in no time and learn from the best.


  
* [Must-have] Experience with development preferably in Python.
* [Must-have] Knowledge of the SQL programming language.
* [Must-have] Experience with data modeling and data warehousing.
* [Must-have] Machine Learning experience.
* [Nice-to-have] Experience with Google Cloud Platform.

**What we have to offer:**

* An exciting job where innovation in technology is not a buzzword but a reality.
* Continuous training & development of soft- and hard skills, including training at several Google locations.
* A competitive salary, in line with your profile.
* Additional benefits.
* An awesome team of colleagues & regular team building activities.
* The ability to work with the world’s leading companies in technology and innovation.
* Hybrid way of working. Working remotely 4 weeks a year.

If you do not feel fully confident that you meet the requirements above, please don’t worry. Just apply. Together we’ll discover what you can bring to the table, in which role you would fit best and how you could potentially grow at Devoteam. We are looking for different levels of seniority.
  

  

**Any questions? Please contact Lyubomira Nikolova at lyubomira.nikolova@devoteam.com**


  
- #techies in our minds, #creatives in our hearts, #change in our DNA.
  

You’ll be part of a bunch of Tech Enthusiasts in a fail-safe culture where everyone, from bright talents to experienced rockstars, is encouraged to continuously innovate and grow. We are a community that is proud of who you are and helps you to become who you want to be. Our dietary constraints: we’re allergic to unnecessary hierarchies and excessive processes. At Devoteam, the only constant is change.
  

  

We drive change & bring creative tech ideas to life for our customers. We do this with 10.000+ business & tech experts EMEA-wide. Our multidisciplinary teams play on the edge of technological innovation and help leading companies to unlock the future. Our award-winning EMEA partnerships with Microsoft, Salesforce, Google, AWS & ServiceNow, enable us to deliver remarkable solutions and empower your career path. Next to these EMEA partnerships we also partner locally with key tech innovators such as Elastic, Atlassian & Red Hat.
company_description: Devoteam is a leading consulting firm focused on digital strategy, tech platforms, cybersecurity and business transformation.

title: Cloud Data Engineer - Senior Consultant
description:
- If you like these keywords you’ll love this role:


#coding #cloud #containers #K8S #linux


Our mission is to build cultures of innovation at companies by transforming the way they work, by modernising their IT infrastructure & apps, and by elevating their customer experiences. As a Premier Google Cloud partner, we do this by implementing innovative Google Cloud solutions and by leveraging cutting-edge AI & Machine Learning technologies.
  

  

Devoteam G Cloud’s certified Cloud engineers build disruptive solutions on Google Cloud Platform to give organisations a competitive advantage. We migrate and modernise legacy applications & IT infrastructure using Cloud Native solutions such as Kubernetes, Anthos and Serverless solutions.
  

  

We help our customers with their hybrid- and multi-Cloud strategies and to get to actionable business insights faster, by accelerating their data & analytics. Together we create scalable, future-proof & secure data journeys. And we build AI & ML solutions on top of this data to help customers to create better customer experiences. Next to that, we give the workplace of the future shape with solutions like Google Workspace.

  
With a team of Software Engineers you will take off on a journey to create a strategic product to facilitate and accelerate customer solutions on Google Cloud. You engineer based on the requirements of the project, but you are also not afraid to suggest solutions and propose your own ideas. You are a Google Cloud Expert, or are looking to become one in no time and learn from the best.


  
* [Must-have] Excellent knowledge of Python.
* [Must-have] Excellent knowledge of SQL.
* [Must-have] Experience with data modeling and data warehousing.
* [Must-have] Experience with Terraform and Bash.
* [Nice-to-have] Experience with Google Cloud Platform.

**What we have to offer:**

* An exciting job where innovation in technology is not a buzzword but a reality.
* Continuous training & development of soft- and hard skills, including training at several Google locations.
* A competitive salary, in line with your profile.
* Additional benefits.
* An awesome team of colleagues & regular team building activities.
* The ability to work with the world’s leading companies in technology and innovation.
* Hybrid way of working. Working remotely 4 weeks a year.

If you do not feel fully confident that you meet the requirements above, please don’t worry. Just apply. Together we’ll discover what you can bring to the table, in which role you would fit best and how you could potentially grow at Devoteam. We are looking for different levels of seniority.
  

  

**Any questions? Please contact Lyubomira Nikolova at lyubomira.nikolova@devoteam.com**


  
- #techies in our minds, #creatives in our hearts, #change in our DNA.
  

You’ll be part of a bunch of Tech Enthusiasts in a fail-safe culture where everyone, from bright talents to experienced rockstars, is encouraged to continuously innovate and grow. We are a community that is proud of who you are and helps you to become who you want to be. Our dietary constraints: we’re allergic to unnecessary hierarchies and excessive processes. At Devoteam, the only constant is change.
  

  

We drive change & bring creative tech ideas to life for our customers. We do this with 10.000+ business & tech experts EMEA-wide. Our multidisciplinary teams play on the edge of technological innovation and help leading companies to unlock the future. Our award-winning EMEA partnerships with Microsoft, Salesforce, Google, AWS & ServiceNow, enable us to deliver remarkable solutions and empower your career path. Next to these EMEA partnerships we also partner locally with key tech innovators such as Elastic, Atlassian & Red Hat.

title: PhD candidate in Network Science
description:
Vacaturenr.
15028
Functie-categorie
Omvang (fte)
1,0
Extern/intern
Extern
Locatie
Leiden
Geplaatst op
16 juli 2024
Sluitingsdatum
1 september 2024


The Faculty of Science and the Leiden Institute of Advanced Computer Science (LIACS) are looking for:

**PhD candidate in Network Science (4 years)**


**About this position**  

Leiden University’s computer science department (LIACS), part of the Faculty of Science, is seeking an enthusiastic and well-qualified PhD candidate in network science, a field also referred to as complex networks or social network analysis. The position is for 4 years and is fully funded.  

The position is part of SSHOC-NL, a five-year national consortium project on advancing methods and infrastructure in, among others, the social sciences. Within SSHOC-NL Leiden University and University of Amsterdam jointly lead the work on large-scale social network analysis, which is the focus of this PhD position. While the position offers a certain degree of freedom in terms of the precise research direction, as part of the broader consortium project, the candidate will be asked to work on community detection in large-scale dynamic networks, and how this is affected by aggregation of the network. This ties into a broader objective of the consortium in which the aim is to understand how privacy-sensitive population-scale (network) data, possibly at an aggregated level, can be made accessible and interoperable.


The candidate will be part of the Platform for Large-scale Analysis of Networks Netherlands (PLANET-NL) interdisciplinary group of researchers in both computer science and social science, which will meet regularly as part of the broader consortium project. One particular object of study of this group, and thus possibly also for the candidate, is the multi-layer population-scale social network data of the Netherlands, featuring twelve years of longitudinal network data on all seventeen million inhabitants of the Netherlands and their family, work, school, neighbor and household ties (see, e.g., https://www.popnet.io).


The candidate will be encouraged to collaborate on projects with other members of the Computational Network Science (CNS, https://cns.liacs.nl) group. Moreover, there are ample opportunities to collaborate with other research groups at LIACS in for example data science, machine learning, text mining and algorithm design. It is furthermore possible to get engaged in (limited) BSc and MSc student (co-)supervision, as well as minor scientific organizational activities. Additionally, there are plenty of opportunities for interaction and collaboration, for example at the Faculty of Science through the Leiden Complex Networks Network (LCN2, https://lcn2.leidenuniv.nl) and nationally through the Dutch Network Science Society (https://www.netsci.nl).


To apply, candidates are required to submit, in addition to an academic CV, a brief motivation letter of at most 2 pages, including a short description of a research idea that the candidate would want to work on in light of this particular position.

**Key responsibilities**

* Conducting research in the area of network science, leading to peer-reviewed publications.
* Writing an article-based PhD thesis within the duration of the position.
* Participating in a broader national computational social science consortium project.
* Limited involvement in co-supervising BSc and MSc students and engaging in minor local organizational activities.
* Assist in relevant teaching activities.

**Required qualifications**

* A MSc\* in computer science or a related field (e.g., mathematics, physics or computational social science), ideally with experience (e.g., through a MSc thesis) on a networks-related topic.
* Experience with programming in Python and/or C++ and/or R, preferably with some large-scale network analysis experience.
* Willingness and ability to work in an interdisciplinary setting working across computer science and social sciences.
* Excellent proficiency of the English language.
* Able to work independently and in a team.
* An academic, creative and curious mindset.
* : excellent candidates not (yet) (fully) past the MSc phase, but sufficiently close to graduation, are also invited to apply.

  

**Our organisation**  

The Faculty of Science is a world-class faculty where staff and students work together in a dynamic international environment. It is a faculty where personal and academic development are top priorities. Our people are committed to expand fundamental knowledge by curiosity and to look beyond the borders of their own discipline; their aim is to benefit science, and to contribute to addressing the major societal challenges of the future. The research carried out at the Faculty of Science is very diverse, ranging from mathematics, information science, astronomy, physics, chemistry and bio-pharmaceutical sciences to biology and environmental sciences. The research activities are organised in eight institutes. These institutes offer eight bachelor’s and twelve master’s programmes. The faculty has grown strongly in recent years and now has more than 2,300 staff and almost 5,000 students. We are located at the heart of Leiden’s Bio Science Park, one of Europe’s biggest science parks, where university and business life come together.


You will be part of the Leiden Institute of Advanced Computer Science (LIACS). LIACS offers courses at the Bachelor and Master of Science level in Computer Science, Data Science and Artificial Intelligence. According to an independent research visitation, LIACS is one of the foremost computer science departments of the Netherlands. We strive for excellence in a caring institute, where excellence, fun, and diversity go hand in hand. We offer a clear and inviting career path to young and talented scientists with the ambition to grow.

**Terms and conditions**  

We offer a full-time (1.0 FTE), fixed-term post for four years, with a salary range from € 2.770,- to  

€ 3.539,- gross per month (pay scale P in accordance with the Collective Labour Agreement for Dutch Universities). The intended starting date is between November 1, 2024 and January 1, 2025.


Leiden University offers an attractive benefits package with additional holiday (8%) and end-of-year bonuses (8.3%) and training and career development. Our individual choices model gives you some freedom to assemble your own set of terms and conditions. Candidates from outside the Netherlands may be eligible for a substantial tax break and fixed compensation for relocation costs.

**D&I statement**  

Diversity and inclusion are core values of Leiden University. Leiden University is committed to becoming an inclusive community which enables all students and staff to feel valued and respected and to develop their full potential. Diversity in experiences and perspectives enriches our teaching and strengthens our research. High quality teaching and research is inclusive.

**Information**  

Prospective supervisors are Frank Takes (Leiden University) and Eelke Heemskerk (University of Amsterdam).  

Inquiries can be made to f.w.takes@liacs.leidenuniv.nl, telephone: +31 71 527 7143. Should you have any questions regarding this position, then you are explicitly invited to informally reach out to before formally applying. If you have any questions regarding the procedure, please contact jobs@liacs.leidenuniv.nl

**Applications**


Please submit online your application no later than **1 September 2024** via the blue button in our application system. Please ensure that you attach the following additional documents, quoting the vacancy number:

* A motivation letter of at most two pages, including a short description of a research idea that the candidate would want to work on in light of this particular position.
* An academic CV listing relevant academic activities thus far.
* A recent writing example (paper or thesis) that you are proud of and reflects your academic writing skills.
* Names and contact details of two people that can be contacted for reference (they should have agreed to be contacted; there is no need to send letters).


The selection procedure and interviews will take place from September 5, 2024 onwards, until a suitable candidate has been found.

title: Materials Scientist / Engineer
description:
Additive manufacturing or 3D printing technologies represent a promising market in the materials sector to realize adapted and functional parts. One of the most widely used technologies is DLP (Digital Light Processing) or VAT polymerization. Admatec Europe develops and produces 3D printers based on this technology.


Admatec Nanodimension division www.admateceurope.com is specialized in additive manufacturing of ceramics and metals. Admatec designs and manufactures printers and develops various ceramic and metallic feedstocks for printing. The current Admaflex 3D printing technology in the market is based on layer-by-layer curing of photosensitive polymers containing metal or ceramic powders. During the printing process, the layers are added and cured with the help of UV-photo curing. After the printing, the parts are cleaned and then thermal de-binded and sintered to a dense material. Our sister company, Formatec Technical Ceramics B.V. produces ceramic and metal parts by injection molding and printing. Both companies are part of Formatec Holding owned by Nano Dimension www.nano-di.com and are therewith a division of an international world player on Additive Manufacturing.


Additive manufacturing of powder metallurgical materials is a combination of three consecutive and connected factors, first the preparation of polymers-based slurries or feedstocks, then the 3D shaping process and finally the de-binding and sintering. To complete our current team, we are looking for a **Materials Scientist / Engineer** for developing high filled polymer systems at Admatec in **Alkmaar, Netherlands.**

**Work description**


You will be part of the Admatec materials team, optimizing and developing materials and processes for current and future printing and production techniques. Your initial tasks will be further understanding and exploring polymer systems and developing new resin mixtures suitable for the type of material defined. Your work will be a support for the R&D team, so you will be part of a multidisciplinary team including engineering, powder metallurgy, software & production. Your main tasks will be:

* Develop a new polymeric composition required and adapted to powder metallurgical processing technology.
* Conduct laboratory tests and analyses related to the behavior of polymers chemically and physically.
* Support and collaborate with the R&D team by providing key expertise on photopolymerization reactions under the Admaflex system.
* Become familiar with the general printing and forming processes by performing technical support in tests for R&D or for customers, preparing feedstock & slurries, tests on post processing steps.
* Operate and maintain laboratory equipment, ensuring reliability of test results, including recording experimental tests in a laboratory notebook, synthesizing results, and preparing detailed reports and presentations.
* Adhere to quality and safety policies and procedures.

  


Requirements:  

  

**Qualifications/ Skills**

* A PhD or master’s degree or Engineer in Polymer science, organic chemistry, or equivalent.
* Skills in characterization approaches of materials (TGA, FTIR, SEM, tensile tests, curing-Kinetics, plasticity, rheology tests...).
* Have solid understanding of the fundamentals of materials science and polymer development with strong knowledge in organic chemistry, polymer rheology, surface chemistry, mechanical and chemical behavior of polymers and ceramic filled polymers.
* Knowledge of additive manufacturing techniques will be a plus but not mandatory.
* Be proactive and have a practical and integrated approach to laboratory work for experimental tests.
* Curious, autonomous, self-motivated with a rigorous scientific approach.
* Excellent teamwork skills and flexibility focused on results and customer requirements.
* Analytical mindset with the ability to interpret and report experimental data.
* Fluent English, reading and writing skills.

**What do we offer**


At Admatec, we offer you the opportunity to join an international company to work in a dynamic, innovative, motivated, and multi-disciplinary team with interesting challenges for a broad spectrum of applications.

* A dynamic, innovative, cooperative working environment.
* Competitive salary & bonus.
* A nice and motivated team
* 30 days annual leave on a full-time basis.
* Travel allowance.
* Flexible working hours.
* A good pension scheme by PME.

If you are interested and meet the above requirements, please apply by submitting your Resume (CV) and cover letter showcasing your interest in materials/polymers science and relevant experience.

title: Senior Machine Learning Scientist I
description:
Role Description:

At Booking.com, data drives our decisions. Technology is at our core. And innovation is everywhere. But our company is more than datasets, lines of code or A/B tests. We’re the thrill of the first night in a new place. The excitement of the next morning. The friends you make. The journeys you take. The sights you see. And the food you sample. Through our products, partners, and people, we make it easier for everyone to experience the world.### **Team and Role Overview**


Ensuring we understand the needs and intentions of our travelers remains a top priority for Booking. With millions of accommodations, flights, taxis, attractions, and car rentals available on our platform, our aim is to assist customers in finding the perfect fit for their journey. Customers may express their needs and intentions directly through their searches or filter usage, while in addition we can further deduct their preferences from their interactions on our platform, such as clicking on specific accommodations rather than others. At Booking, we consistently analyze and model customer behavior to personalize the traveler experience.
Following successful user intent and needs modeling across various parts of the company, these efforts have recently been consolidated into a central team, and as part of the **Traveler Centric Data track** within the new **Marketplace business unit** we are now expanding further. The **User Intent Modelling team** is building upon past successes, while also deepening on innovation to push the boundaries for personalisation even further by leveraging innovative Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence. It is a crucial aspect of the Marketplace vision to ensure we guide our travelers to the most suitable products and facilitate seamless connections between the various parts of their trip.
As a Senior Machine Learning Scientist, you will be a strong technical leader within the team, setting the technical strategy, while generating operational business impact. You will be developing state-of-the-art Machine Learning models, owning the design and delivery of ML systems, from initial idea-generation, collecting business requirements from product stakeholders to implementation. You will actively coach and mentor less experienced Machine Learning Scientists and Machine Learning Engineers in the team and work closely together with Data Engineers, Software Engineers and Product Managers.### **Key Job Responsibilities**

* Translate broad business problems into ML/AI challenges and develop a targeted research plan to identify the best approach within the constraints of the production environment.
* Develop the technical strategy for machine learning on a product family by designing innovative ML/AI models, algorithms, and approaches that deliver both short-term commercial impact and longer-term differentiated business value and customer experiences.
* Work in a multi-disciplined team where you’ll take full ownership of turning discoveries and ideas into products through machine learning (incl. understanding product requirements, data discovery, model development and evaluation, to implementation of a full production pipeline for both batch and stream-based deployment).
* Define and build proof-of-concepts to test new ideas and demonstrate their potential value to relevant stakeholders.
* Develop production-grade ML code for models, features, and pipelines, accounting for scalability, latency, realtime requirements, monitoring and retraining.
* Build readable and reusable code, using the right technologies and coding methodologies applying knowledge of business area tools and product needs.
* Continuously evolve your craft by keeping up to date with the latest developments in ML/AI and related technologies, introducing them to the machine learning community and promoting their application.
* Promote platform-based development and reuse by coaching teams in abstracting individual business problems to generalized ML/AI products, rather than point solutions, and in identifying horizontal opportunities across multiple business domains.
* Maintain a highly cross-disciplinary perspective, solving issues by applying approaches and methods from across a variety of ML/AI disciplines and related fields. Coach others through evidence and clear communication, explaining advanced technical concepts in simpler terms.
* Actively contribute to Machine Learning at Booking.com through training, exploration of new technologies, interviewing, onboarding and mentoring colleagues.

### **Role Qualifications and Required Skills**

* Strong relevant work and/or academic experience (MSc + 8 years of working experience, or PhD + 6 years), involved in the development and application of Machine Learning.
* Masters degree, PhD or equivalent experience in a quantitative field (e.g. Computer Science, Mathematics, Artificial Intelligence, Physics, etc.).
* We prefer candidates with Deep Learning experience, especially when applied to large-scale datasets. Experience with TensorFlow is a plus.
* Ability to design an applied research plan for a product family from scratch as evidenced by peer-review publication or similar track record.
* Experience on multiple machine learning facets: working with large data sets, model development, statistics, experimentation, data visualization, optimization, software development.
* Prior experience with Feature Engineering and putting machine learning models in production is a plus.
* Strong working knowledge of Python, Hadoop, SQL, Spark or similar Big Data technologies.
* Experience collaborating cross functionally in the development of machine learning products (e.g. Developers, ML Engineers, Product Managers, etc.).
* Excellent English communication skills, both written and verbal; the ability to convey your message to team members and other collaborators.

### **Benefits & Perks****: Global Impact, Personal Relevance**


Booking.com’s Total Rewards Philosophy is not only about compensation but also about benefits. Our Total Rewards strive to make it easier for you to experience all that life has to offer on your terms so that you can focus on what really matters. We offer competitive compensation as well as thoughtful, valuable, and even fun benefits which include:* Headquarters located in one of the most dynamic and cosmopolitan cities in Europe: Amsterdam.
* Contribute to a high scale, sophisticated, world-class product and see the real time impact of your work on millions of travelers worldwide.
* Be part of a truly international fast paced environment and performance driven culture.
* Full relocation support for you and your family to move to Amsterdam. We have fine-tuned this process by successfully relocating over 300 Technology professionals to Amsterdam in the last year alone!
* Performance-based company that offers 29 vacation days, career advancement, and lucrative compensation, including bonuses and stock potential.
* Discount on Booking.com accommodations with the “Booking Deal” including other perks and benefits.
* Company-sponsored family and social activities to help our employees become integrated with each other and Dutch culture.
* Diverse and creative colleagues from every corner of the world.
* Health, life, and disability insurance\*
* Annual paid time off and generous paid leave scheme including: parent, grandparent, bereavement, and care leave.
* Hybrid working including flexible working arrangements, and up to 20 days per year working from abroad (home country).
* Industry leading product discounts for yourself, friends, and family, including automatic Genius Level 3 status and quarterly Booking.com wallet credit.
* Free access to online learning platforms, development and mentorship programs, and a complimentary Headspace membership.
* On-site meals, coffee, and snacks, including healthy and vegan options, daily\*

### **DEI****: Diversity, Equity and Inclusion at Booking.com**


Inclusion, Diversity, Belonging, Wellbeing and Volunteering (IDBWV) have been a core part of our company culture since day one. This ongoing journey starts with our very own employees, who represent over 140 nationalities and a wide range of ethnic and social backgrounds, genders and sexual orientations.
Take it from our Chief People Officer, Paulo Pisano: “At Booking.com, the diversity of our people doesn’t just create a unique workplace, it also creates a better and more inclusive travel experience for everyone. Inclusion is at the heart of everything we do. It’s a place where you can make your mark and have a real impact in travel and tech.”
We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable adjustment to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment.
Booking.com is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. We strive to move well beyond traditional equal opportunity and work to create an environment that allows everyone to thrive.### **Career Development Opportunities**

* Bi-annual performance conversations, company-wide mentoring program, and internal development opportunities
* Unlimited access to online learning platforms: Udemy, Coursera, LinkedIn learning, O'reilly

### **Application Process**


The interview process will entail: an initial screen by one of our Recruiters, and a total of 3 Business interviews (including a take home business case).

title: Data Science Engineer - Offshore Energy
description:
### **How you can make your mark**


Are you a recent graduate or do you have a few years of work experience? Are you currently searching for a job that offers the opportunity to work on globally impactful operations, all while being part of a dynamic and enthusiastic team?


As a Data Scientist, you will be part of the Boskalis’ Data Science and Engineering (DSE) community. You will be working from the Global Engineering department with Offshore Energy (OE). This small, yet expert team operates at the intersection of data technology and our core businesses of offshore services & operations. Together, we work on three key areas: data analysis and automation for our global projects, developing the in-house Boskalis.World data and application platform, and growing our Boskalis Python community.


Imagine automating the execution of large-scale offshore projects and optimizing the performance of our innovative Bokalift crane vessels within our Boskalis fleet. In this role, you will have the chance to contribute to our operations by utilizing your skills in algorithm development and creating data insights. You will have the opportunity to develop on cloud technology platforms like Azure DevOps and Databricks, while collaborating with OE Business Units (BUs), such as Heavy Lifting & Marine Transport, Subsea Cables, Marine & Subsea Services and Fleet Management. You will create tools that support the BUs, making a real impact on their organizations.


We want to optimize the complex logistics on our multi-disciplinary projects, not only in desk studies but also during the actual construction works in the field. We are looking for talent with an understanding of marine construction works, statistics, simulation, and software development. Don't worry if you are not proficient in all areas yet - we encourage continuous learning and development, your colleagues will help you out and we will provide on-the-job training for the right candidate!

**Your responsibilities as a data scientist**

Your main tasks will be:

* To develop & implement DSE projects with and for the OE BUs, improving their commercial & operational performance.
* To develop our capabilities in logistics simulation and optimization. We use open and private source Python packages to identify optimal execution methods by taking into account fleet capacity, weather conditions and the potential for unforeseen events. This is a co-development with Boskalis R&D, Dredging and OE colleagues.
* To develop new tools and improve Python models used by the BUs and in close collaboration with your colleagues in the business.
* To create web apps and dashboards to guide operational and department teams with their project activities by data fusion, algorithms, and visualizations.


We will guide and coach you to work in our development toolchain and the Boskalis business, for you to quickly:

* Design and create fast and scalable APIs for colleagues in the business.
* Identify new automation and data-driven solutions for the company.
* Be able to enter a project team with a good skillset and experience to figure out their needs and independently work on solutions.
* Be a good source of knowledge for colleagues of other departments. Be able to educate, motivate and inspire data solutions.

**Your qualities**


You can make your mark as data scientist if you have:

* An MSc (or BSc) degree in engineering, econometrics, mathematics, or computer science;
* A proactive attitude will really help you integrate within the team and company. Next to that, very important is a drive for curiosity and learning;
* Experience with analysis and visualization of geospatial and timeseries data, modelling, and simulation techniques, using mostly Python;
* Experience with Docker, Kubernetes, PySpark or Databricks is not a must but a pre;
* A good command of written and spoken English.

### **We offer**

**What you can expect**

* A dynamic environment: A job where you can make an impact, in an earth-moving company, as part of a diverse, international team of experts.
* Rewarding conditions: A competitive salary and much more, including holiday allowance, holiday entitlement of 31 days (based on a full-time contract), a non-contributory pension scheme, collective schemes such as company health insurance and travel allowance.
* Career development: Plenty of opportunities to realize your full potential. Challenge yourself with (online) courses in our Boskalis academy.
* The Boskalis campus: Experience the unique Boskalis Campus (6 main Buildings in Papendrecht and 1 in Abu Dhabi), complete with restaurants, sports fields, and a wharf where our vessels dock. We offer a state-of-the-art auditorium, brainstorming rooms, experience center for client meetings, and a barista corner where you can connect with colleagues.
* Young Boskalis: Are you under 36? Come and join Young Boskalis! Have fun and join in social and sports activities ranging from pub quizzes to yoga, bootcamps and an annual sailing boat race. Networking and knowledge sharing are a vital part of Young Boskalis as well.

**Extra information**

* Your team: You will be part of small, mostly young and diverse team of data engineers, software developers and domain architects.
* Where you will work: For office-based roles, in consultation with your manager and your team, you work partly at home and partly in the office. Occasionally, it is required to do short business trips abroad.
* Full/part-time job: Depending on what you prefer the position is full-time (40) or part-time (32 hours a week)
* Next steps: Apply easily by completing the online application form. Interviews are held online or in the office. Once it’s clear we’re a good match, we’ll make you an offer – and look forward to welcoming you to the company.

### **About Boskalis**


Working at Boskalis is about creating new horizons and sustainable solutions. In a world where population growth, an increase of global trade, demand for (new) energy and climate change are driving forces, we challenge you to make your mark in finding innovative and relevant solutions for complex infrastructural and marine projects.


Boskalis has one of the largest global fleets of specialized offshore vessels, allowing us to carry out a broad range of offshore activities. We provide innovative and sustainable all-round solutions to tackle major worldwide maritime challenges. Our Offshore Energy division supports sustainable energy solutions such as wind energy as well as traditional fossil facilities. We’re involved in the entire journey from developing and transporting to maintaining and decommissioning these facilities.

### **Interested?**


We are more than happy to answer your questions about the position of Data Science Engineer. Please contact Tim Gouweleeuw, Recruiter via tim.gouweleeuw@boskalis.com.

***Disclaimer for recruitment and selection agencies***  

  

*We don’t accept any unsolicited applications or CVs from recruitment and selection agencies. In general, we don’t appreciate acquisition and this also applies to Boskalis colleagues or associated Boskalis companies.*

  

#LI-TG1

title: Data Scientist
description:
**Werk is van grote betekenis voor mens en maatschappij. Gezamenlijk zetten ons ruim 1.500 professionals zich dagelijks in voor ruim 65.000 werkgevers en ruim 1,5 miljoen werkenden om gezond, gemotiveerd en competent aan het werk te zijn en blijven. En dat levert een schat aan data op waar wij ons als afdeling Research & Development graag in vastbijten en deze vertalen in vernieuwende inzichten en datagedreven innovaties met inzet van AI.**



**Hoe ga je meer betekenen als Data Scientist**
-----------------------------------------------


Als Data Scientist bij HumanTotalCare denk je iedere dag vanuit jouw kennis en kunde mee over manieren waarop onze organisatie en professionals met behulp van data effectiever kunnen werken, en hoe we meer kunnen betekenen voor werknemers en werkgevers. Nu en straks.


Samen met je R&D collega’s en andere professionals uit de hele organisatie ontwikkel je concepten en ideeën die, via een innovatieproces met experimenten en pilots, tot schaalbare oplossingen voor de collega’s en klanten leiden. Dit doe je niet alleen en van achter je bureau, maar samen met je directe collega’s en in dialoog met de business.


Wij zijn er om in de praktijk belangrijk te zijn, en zetten hiervoor data en technologie samen met onze domeinkennis in. Denk aan het ontwikkelen van modellen voor beslisondersteuning in het verzuimproces, waarmee we het verschil maken door de juiste interventie op het juiste moment te initiëren. Of aan een datagedreven preventieproces waardoor een diagnose of prognose sneller gesteld kan worden en preventieve acties gerichter kunnen worden geadviseerd. Maar ook aan inzet van AI op de werkplek waarmee we onze professionals kunnen ondersteunen met efficiënte werkprocessen. We willen onze toegevoegde waarde meetbaar maken en monitoren onze KPI’s. Zo blijven we samen leren om onze processen en diensten te verbeteren.  



**Met wie ga je meer betekenen**
--------------------------------


Je wordt onderdeel van het veelzijdige R&D team, bestaande uit ongeveer 15 vaste collega’s. Met een mooie mix van consultants, research & business development, data scientists, project support medewerkers en machine learning engineers, aangevuld met een flexibele schil van onderzoeksassistenten, studenten en scientist practitioners ga jij impact maken.


Met een grote diversiteit aan kennis en kunde brengen wij data, wetenschap, technologie en praktijk bij elkaar. Dit doen we in nauwe samenwerking met collega’s van Business Intelligence, staf en IT. De organisatie weet ons goed te vinden en we hebben toegang tot een breed scala aan expertise van onze arbo-professionals. Van bedrijfsartsen tot arbeids- en organisatiedeskundigen en van ergonomen tot psychologen.



### **Wat is écht leuk aan deze baan**

* We hebben een schatkist vol relevante data. Van procesdata, verzuimdata, vragenlijsten tot vrije tekst of gebruik van onze platformen. Over onze dienstverlening heen, zowel inhoudelijke data rondom gezondheid van werknemers als procesinformatie en KPI’s (bijv. klanttevredenheid, omzet). Er is nog genoeg te ontginnen en veel ruimte voor jouw ideeën. Uiteraard binnen de kaders van de wet, privacy staat hoog bij ons in het vaandel.
* Jouw werk maakt echt verschil voor werkend Nederland. Wat je bedenkt kan ook echt in productie worden gebracht. Daarbij is er veel draagvlak binnen de organisatie voor wat je doet.
* Je wordt onderdeel van een hecht team, en elke dinsdag neem je deel aan de R&D dag met updates, demo’s of innovatiesessies.
* Je bepaalt voor een groot deel zelf waar je jouw energie in steekt en de meeste toegevoegde waarde ziet. Je krijgt veel autonomie om je werk in te richten zoals jij dat wilt. Zo vormt de functie zich naar jouw expertise en ambitie.

### **Is er ook iets minder leuk**


Het vakgebied is volop in ontwikkeling. Soms willen we te snel of moeten we eerst de data nog ontsluiten. Het is niet altijd een gespreid bedje en je bent nog aan het bouwen van jouw positie als Data Scientist binnen de organisatie. Maar met een flinke dosis doorzettingskracht en een goed verhaal kom je echt al een heel eind.



**Wat neem je mee**
-------------------


Nieuwsgierigheid en een beetje vakidiotie. Jij bent op de hoogte van de laatste inhoudelijke en technologische ontwikkelingen. En komt er weer wat interessants voorbij, dan maak jij je dit snel eigen. Je experimenteert met de mogelijke toepassing(en) hiervan. Je snapt de interactie tussen hardware en software en bedenkt graag dingen die echt een bijdrage leveren aan de praktijk. Daarbij heb je affiniteit met ons vakgebied van o.a. werk, gezondheid en gedragsverandering. En je weet hoe je jouw boodschap over de bühne moet krijgen. Complexe materie kun je uitleggen in de taal van je gesprekspartner, waar deze zich ook in de organisatie bevindt.


Verder vragen we het volgende:

* Een relevante universitaire opleiding (data/computer science of statistiek en methoden).
* Bij voorkeur minimaal 5 jaren relevante werkervaring als Data analist of Data Scientist en je hebt eerder gewerkt met grote hoeveelheden data, inclusief data cleaning.
* Je bent goed thuis in statistiek en onderzoeksmethoden.
* Je kunt uitstekend uit de voeten met Python, en liefst ook met een andere programmeertaal zoals R of Java.
* Je hebt ervaring met machine learning en bij voorkeur ook met andere data-analyse technieken, zoals simulatie, deep learning, en Natural Language Processing.
* Het is een pré als je ervaring hebt met infrastructuur en softwarearchitectuur die nodig zijn om modellen in softwareproductie te kunnen integreren (bijv. Docker, Kubernetes, microservices en REST API’s).
* De werkzaamheden en de documentatie zijn grotendeels in het Engels. Omdat je data vertaalt naar de business in onze organisatie, is het van belang dat je voldoende Nederlands spreekt en schrijft (B2).

**Wat krijg je ervoor terug**
-----------------------------


Als HumanTotalCare zetten we ons in voor een gezond, gemotiveerd en competent werkend Nederland. Vanuit onze merken adviseren en ondersteunen we werkgevers en werkenden gedurende hun hele werkzame leven. Zo zijn we van betekenis voor werkenden, organisaties en onze maatschappij. En wat we naar buiten beloven, doen we ook intern. We bieden je dan ook:

* **Een open, informele werksfeer.** We doen het voor, door en met elkaar.
* De mogelijkheid om **hybride te werken**, waarbij we er graag voor zorgen dat jouw thuiswerkplek ergonomisch helemaal op orde is. Er is veel aandacht en ruimte voor een **gezonde work-life balance**.
* Daarnaast ben je altijd welkom in ons **kantoor** in Utrecht of in Son. Op beide locaties werken de R&D’ers samen en drinken graag een kop koffie met elkaar. Dinsdag is onze vaste kantoordag.
* **Een warme introductie in onze organisatie** **en de afdeling**. Vanuit R&D hebben we een uitgebreid inwerkprogramma samengesteld waarin je het team leert kennen en meeloopt met verschillende collega’s binnen en buiten de afdeling.
* Een salaris tussen de € 4.600 – € 6.500, we kijken bij inschaling naar de kennis en ervaring die je meebrengt. En daarnaast een goede pensioenregeling en 25 vakantiedagen (met de mogelijkheid om bij te kopen). Plus een laptop, mobiele telefoon en reiskostenvergoeding.
* Direct een **vast contract**.
* Alle aandacht voor preventie en vitaliteit. We zijn trots op ons vitaliteits- en ontwikkelprogramma.
* **Gezellige evenementen en borrels**, zowel met de afdeling als met de hele organisatie, omdat we informele contacten met collega’s ook heel belangrijk vinden.

**Je sollicitatie**
-------------------


Wil jij als Data Scientist #meerbetekenen voor werkend Nederland? Mooi, we zien je sollicitatie graag tegemoet.


Heb je inhoudelijke vragen over de functie? Neem dan contact op met Corporate Recruiter Jelmer Ouwerkerk via 0643292824. **Acquisitie op basis van deze vacature wordt niet gewaardeerd.**
**Sollicitatieprocedure**
-------------------------


**Neem contact op**
-------------------


Wil je meer informatie over deze vacature? Neem dan contact op met de recruiter.### **Jelmer Ouwerkerk**
